Adicionalmente cría y vende animales menores. Con estos ingresos ella se encarga de sacar adelante a los suyos.

María desea adquirir algunos insumos como arroz, papas, aceite entre otros con los cuales desea ampliar su producción para percibir mayores ingresos por las ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 41 years old, separated, and lives together with her two grown-up children in the settlement of San Luis, a rural area of La Victoria district which is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She prepares and sells food.  She prepares the food in her home and then offers it for sale opposite a school in her area.  Her customers are the school students and local inhabitants.  In addition, she rears and sells small animals.  With this income she helps her family to get ahead in life.

María would like to purchase some ingredients including rice, potatoes and oil with which she wants to expand her production in order to increase the income from her sales.  For this reason she decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 300 nuevos soles.  This will help her to achieve her goal.

María is a fighter and has a great desire to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: To purchase some ingredients including rice, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta C. is from the village of Bog-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old and single. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail store, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, beverages, and snack foods in the local community. Modesta has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Modesta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Modesta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Valle Nuevo, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Mochumí, un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral y animales menores. El cría estos animales en su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un vuen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es la fuente mas importante de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que siempre trata de dar lomejor de si para mantenerla.

Jose desea adquirir más animales y alimento para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir desarrollándose como empresario y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 32 year old father who resides with his wife and two children in the Valle Nuevo sector, a rural area situated in the District of Mochumí, Lambayeque Province. This community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José raises and sells poultry and other small animals. He raises the animals at home and when they have reached the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to merchants that visit the area where he lives. This activity is an important source of income, so he tries his best to maintain his business.

José wants to acquire more animals and feed so that he can expand his business and increase his sales and earnings. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help him accomplish his goal.

José is a peaceful and responsible person. His greatest wish is to continue developing as an entrepreneur and gradually improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire more animals & animal feed

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 21 years old, single, and has one infant. To make a living, Analou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snack foods and retailing rice per kilogram in the local community. Analou has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Analou is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Analou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Esmilda tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Cruce Nuevo Jaén del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario por los cuales usualmente tendrían que transladarse hasta el pueblo de Olmos para adquirirlos. Su negocio cuenta con una clientela estable que prefiere el buen trato y los productos de calidad que brinda.

Esmilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su negocio pueda crecer y desarrollarse correctamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Esmilda es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Esmilda is 34 years old, single, and lives with her family in the village of Cruce Nuevo Jaén in the District of Olmos. This agricultural area is part of Lambayeque Province and located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Esmilda sells basic necessities and groceries from a store located in her home. There she offers her customers daily consumer products that she obtains in the town of Olmos. Her business has established customers who prefer the good service and high quality products that she offers.

Esmilda wants to expand her business by acquiring more products so that her business will grow and develop properly. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help her accomplish this goal.

Esmilda is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai K., 22, is married and lives with her husband and child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. and her husband sell soymilk, earning an income of about $4.90 per day. K. has to spend $102 on food, $5 on electricity and water supplies, and $60 on other necessary expenses every month.  

K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a machine for producing soymilk in order to improve her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph because K. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a machine for producing soymilk

loans.name: Maria Amanda

texts.es:
María Amanda es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande de la provincia de Piura, se encuentra situado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de camino desde la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la ganadería. Ella cría vacas en su domicilio y comercializa diversos productos derivados de la leche que extrae a diario. Por ejemplo, de la leche que produce prepara algunos dulces como natillas y manjarblanco. Adicionalmente vende leche a la municipalidad de Tambogrande, la cual se encarga a su vez de distribuirla a los sectores más pobres del distrito.

María desea adquirir alimento para sus vacas de modo que estas pueda producir mas leche, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y entregada a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María is a livestock farmer.  She raises cows at home and sells dairy products from the milk which she gets from her cows every day.  For example, from her milk she prepares sweets such as custard and 'manjar blanco' (a dessert made by cooking and thickening milk, then adding sugar).  She also sells milk in the town of Tambogrande which is then distributed to the poorest areas of the district.

María would like to purchase feed for her cows so that they can produce more milk.  This is why she is requesting her first loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

María is an enterprising woman who is committed to her family.  The income which she makes is used to help her husband with the financial upkeep of their family.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her cows

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa S. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Clarisa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Clarisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products, including fish like bangus, sardines, and mackerel, in the local community. She decided to start a fish vending business because she finds it more profitable than a sari-sari (variety) retail store. Clarisa has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Clarisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Clarisa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Clarisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V., 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. sells vegetables, earning an income of about $3.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

V. has to spend $65 on food, $3 on electricity and water supplies, and $18 on other necessary expenses every month. V. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband improve his business

loans.name: Maria Magdelena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo. Ella cuenta con una clientela estable, pero aún asi siempre trata de buscar nuevos clientes ya que, a más cantidad de pedidos, mayor es la cantidad de ganancias que percibe. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos productos por su cuenta y empezar a contar con un stock fijo de productos que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Ella es una mujer responsable,activa y bastante emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida..
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a 43 year old mother who resides with her husband and two children in the District of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the province and region of Piura. This community is more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been selling beauty products by catalog for four years. She has an established clientele, but is always looking to attract new customers and generate more orders so that she can receive additional income. The earnings from her business enable her to support her family’s finances.

María wants to acquire a few products to keep on hand and build up a fixed inventory of merchandise so that she can meet the demand of her customers without having to wait until the end of the month when orders arrive. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 500 PEN to accomplish her goal.

María is a responsible, active, and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise to build up a fixed inventory

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita O. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Helenita is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Helenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts and also making and selling charcoal in the local community. Helenita has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Helenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Helenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Such

texts.en:
Such K., 61, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. is a farmer, earning an income of about $1 per day. Her husband buys firewood to resell, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

K. has to spend $40 on food, $6 on electricity and water supplies, and $72 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of $700 to repair the car in order to transport firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair a car in order to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a tres hijos en el caserío Nuevo Yapato del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, aproximadamente a tres horas y media de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza y a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que estas bebidas son bastante consumidas en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Celestina desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más cerveza e insumos para seguir preparando Chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Celestina is a 41 year old mother who resides with her husband and three children in the village of Nuevo Yapato in the District of Tambogrande, an agricultural area that is situated in the province and region of Piura. The community is located approximately three and a half hours away by highway from the city of Chiclayo.

Celestina sells beer and prepares “chicha de jora” (a traditional Peruvian beverage from ancient times that is made from a special type of corn). She prepares this beverage in her home and then offers it for sale. Celestina’s business has been well-received because these beverages are consumed often in the area, particularly for various celebrations and parties. In addition, many of the local workers have a custom of drinking “chicha” prior to starting their jobs because they believe it provides them with energy and vigor.

Celestina wants to expand her business by acquiring more beer and supplies for making “chicha”. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish her goal.

Celestina is a peaceful and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase beer & supplies for making "chicha de jora"

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano – marginal del distrito de La Victoria, una zona ubicada cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de jugos en un puesto de venta ubicado en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (el mercado de abastos mas grande de la zona). Ella atiende en su negocio durante las mañanas y se vale del mismo para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a la calidad del servicio brindado.

Rosa María desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio para prevenir algunos daños que puedan presentarse producto de las lluvias que suelen presentarse en verano . Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y que desea lo mejor para su familia. Por ello se esfuerza diariamente trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 21 years old, married, and resides with her family in a marginalized urban sector in the District of La Victoria, which is located near the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Rosa María has been selling juices from a vending post located at the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo (which happens to be the largest food market in the area). She manages her business in the mornings and also helps her husband with the family finances. Her business has been well-received because of the quality of service that she provides.

Rosa María wants to make some improvements to her home that will prevent any damages that could occur from the summer rains. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Rosa María is an enterprising young woman who wants the best for her family. For this reason, she strives each in her work to get ahead.

loans.use: Pay for home improvements

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of Bog-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and snack foods, in the local community. Aside from the new business of selling food and a variety of products, she also makes and sells charcoal. Helen has been in business for over 11 years, and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en:
Chhet D., 39, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. D. is a farmer, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband buys pigs to resell, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. D. has to spend $60 on food, $7 on electricity and water supplies, and $75 on other necessary expenses every month. 

D. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more pigs to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. D. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for resale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una madre de familia de años de edad que reside junto a su esposo ya sus dos hijos en el sector El Salitral del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza.

Se dedica a la venta de menestras cocidas recorriendo las diversas calles del complejo Moshoqueque, para ello es ayudada por su esposo que tiene una mototaxi. Juntos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia y progresar.

Rosario desea adquirir más menestras con las cuales pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir ayudando a su esposo a salir adelante. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Rosario es una mujer responsable y que siempre busca el desarrollo de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Rosario is a mother who lives with her husband and two children in El Salitral, José Leonardo Ortiz district.  This is one of the most densely populated districts in the region and has one of the highest levels of poverty.

She sells cooked pulses and legumes throughout the streets of the Moshoqueque complex.  She is helped by her husband who has a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cart in back for passengers).  Together they try to help their family succeed and make progress in life.

Rosario would like to acquire more pulses and legumes which would enable her to expand her business and make more income.  This increased income would enable her to keep helping her husband to make progress.  For this reason she decided to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles which will help her achieve her goal.

Rosario is a responsible woman and is always looking to improve her family's situation.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Purchase of pulses and legumes to expand her sales business

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en el sector Nuevo San Lorenzo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Ella ofrece sus productos por pedidos, a más pedidos realizados, obtiene mayores ganancias. Por ello siempre se esfuerza por conseguir más clientes. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y con varios pedidos por atender.

Janneth desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos por su cuenta, de modo que pueda contar con un stock permanente de productos y pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes sin tener que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llegan los pedidos. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janneth is 27 years old, single, and does not have any family obligations. She lives with her parents in the Nuevo San Lorenzo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of the most populated districts in the region with high rates of poverty.

Janneth sells beauty products through a catalog. She offers her products by taking orders. The more orders she completes, the greater the income she is able to earn. Therefore, she always strives to attract more customers. Janneth currently has an established customer base and receives different orders that she must fulfill.

In order to expand her business, Janneth wants to buy more products so that she can have a permanent inventory which will enable her to meet the demands of her customers without having to wait until the end of the month when the orders arrive. To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN.

Janneth is a young entrepreneur who has the drive to succeed. The income she generates from her business will be a great help to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her family members with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics to increase her sales

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: La señora Ana Victoria M. R. vive en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos los cuales estudian, su esposo labora en Lima como vigilante en una empresa de costura el cual le envía dinero de forma semanal. La solicitante posee un negocio de venta de abarrotes y bazar desde hace doce años, estuvo en Lima durante dos años por el cual dejó acargo su negocio a su hermana pero después del terremoto retornó a Ica asumiendo su negocio. Solicita el crédito para realizar inversión en su bazar en compra de regalos y ropa para la campaña navideña. Se otorgará el crédito por que cuenta con capacidad para asumir obligación.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Victoria M. R. lives in her own home with her three children who are in school. Her husband works in Lima as a security guard at a dressmaking business and sends home money on a weekly basis.

Ana Victoria has been managing a grocery store and a bazaar for twelve years. During the two years that she lived in Lima, she left her sister in charge of her business but regained control after the earthquake that hit Ica. Ana Victoria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of gifts and clothing to stock her bazaar for the holiday season. Her request is being granted since she has the capacity to meet this obligation.

loans.use: Purchase gifts & clothing for the holiday season

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
María Emilia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Reside junto a su familia en el sector Barsallo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza. 

Se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón en el mercado Moshoqueque. Ella adquiere el producto de los diversos pobladores de la zona y los ofrece en venta a las personas que requieren este producto como comerciantes y dueños de restaurantes. El negocio funciona en base a pedidos y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Ella desea contar con más capital para poder adquirir más mercadería y de ese modo satisfacer los pedidos con los que aún cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

María es una mujer responsable y que siempre busca el desarrollo de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María Emilia is 38 years old, single, and does not have any children to support. She resides with her family in the Barsallo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz District, one of the most populated districts in the region with high rates of poverty.

María buys and sells charcoal at the Moshoqueque Market. She acquires her products from different villagers in the area and then sells them to people who want to buy them, such as merchants and restaurant owners. Her business is based on the orders she receives and the income she generates enables her to assist her husband with covering the family expenses.

María wants to have additional capital so that she can acquire more inventory and fulfill the orders she has already received. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can keep up with customer demand.

María is a responsible woman who is always looking after the development of her family. The people who know María have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal so that she can fulfill her orders

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Celia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Celia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergent, biscuits and snack foods, in the local community. Celia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Celia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Celia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang L., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Heang sells clothes and is a tailor, earning an income of about USD 4.3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Heang has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 1.5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.

She is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more clothes to resell, and in the future would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine P., from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province, is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as lotion, shampoo and deodorant in the local community. She also has a Personal Care and Fuller Life business. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her third loan for 11000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Catherine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecelio

texts.en:
Cecelio R., from the village of Tubod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province, is 57 years old, married and has six grown children. To make a living, Cecelio owns and operates a service-based business providing multi-purpose cab services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over 10 years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cecelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, he is now requesting his fourth loan for 10000 PHP to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of his vehicle. Cecelio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the vehicle

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen K., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. sells groceries, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. K. has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 35 USD on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda L. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Veneranda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Veneranda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, coffee, biscuits, and breads in the local community. Veneranda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veneranda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veneranda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Veneranda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Veneranda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Pem

texts.en: Pem S., 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells groceries and raises pigs at home, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a repairman, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. has to spend 50 USD on food, 23 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase containers to stock pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy containers to stock pig food

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en:
Yorng C., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

C. sells vegetables, earning an income of about 4 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. C. has to spend 60 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 25 USD on other necessary expenses every month.  

C. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C. appears in the photograph with her family members.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to improve the business

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en:
Sixto I. Jr. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old. Sixto is married and has eight adult children. 

Sixto owns a business venture providing recycling services in which he primarily buys and sells plastics, empty bottles and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Sixto has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sixto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sixto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional scrap metal and other recyclables to buy and sell. Sixto is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. M. is 65 years old and happily married. She and her husband were blessed with three children: Marivic, age 34; Jessie Boy, age 30; and Julius, age 23. All of their children are degree holders and are busy of their own professional work.  Victoria is old already, but is still strong and determined to have her own source of income.

The main source of she and her husband's income is their rug making business which they have had for six years now. The rugs are crafted by sewing pieces of remnant fabric together.  Once they make a small or big rug, they sell it. According to Victoria, this business gives them enough income to cover their expenses.  Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has also contributed to helping their business do well.  This is the second time a loan of Victoria's has been posted to the Kiva website for funding.  She hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to make her rug making business grow more. If she is able to generate greater profit from her business, she wants to save for the future of her family.

loans.use: as working capital for a rug making business

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: In 2004, Dionisia joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost six years, she has shown very good performance in terms of her attendance at center meetings, weekly repayments and business. She is therefore qualified to obtain larger loans. Dionisia runs a sari-sari store. Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from a marketplace. Dionisia wants to continue her business. It gives her family good income to support the education needs of her five children. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income. Dionisia dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding to another village. Her five children are her inspiration to pursue her business. She now feels very happy about the service of ASHI and Kiva. It gives her a big opportunity to pursue her family's dreams. She hopes that they continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital to improve her business and income

The first few loans she received enabled her to support her family’s rug-making business. Susan hopes to expand her business and meet the growing demands of her customers.  She is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase raw materials needed by her business.  The capital will fund further expansion of the family venture to support Susan’s dreams for her three children and her grandchildren to have a decent way of life.  Her long-term goal is to have a manufacturing shop years from now so that she can provide employment opportunities to others in her village.

She thanks Kiva for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.
