loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Buvaisha's Group

texts.en:
The Kyrgyz Republic's economy was severely affected by the collapse of the Soviet Union and the resulting loss of its vast market. In 1990, some 98% of Kyrgyz exports went to other parts of the Soviet Union. Thus, the nation's economic performance in the early 1990s was worse than any other former Soviet republic except war-torn Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Tajikistan. While economic performance has improved in the last few years, difficulties remain in securing adequate fiscal revenues and providing a sufficient social safety net.

Buvaisha K., 48, is from the southern small town Kadamjai. A mother of four children, she is an immunologist in a local doctor hospital. Her husband is busy with a private carting business. Their oldest daughter has left to Russia for work, the youngest goes to school. The business of raising cattle started, when Buvaisha’s husband came back after hard work in Russia and invested earned money in this business.  Profits from raising cattle have helped them to buy a car, which became the next source of earning money.  With money received from this loan, Buvaisha wants to purchase six farm animals for breeding. In the near future, they plan to open a small shop in their village. 

Burul O., 37, has two daughters. Her husband is a mechanic and Burul is engaged in sewing national accessories. They also breed livestock to make money. The purpose of the loan is to purchase two units of livestock for breeding. 

Suksur A., 56, is married. Her husband is a security guard in a local combine. They have three daughters. The family owns a cow and two calves. The purpose of the loan is to increase the family's number of cattle. 

Tilyakhan S., 39, is a nurse in a local hospital in Kadamjai. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a dairy cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

They live in Gitaru, Kikuyu where she does the farming activity. Most of her customers are also residents of this village. Mercy takes some products to the nearby open air market.

She is applying for her second loan of Kshs 30,000 to buy animal feeds. With the anticipated profit she plans to grow the business and hopes to manage a large-scale milk supply.  Mercy desires to see her children realize their goals through better education in the future

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy feeds for her pigs and ingredients for her guava jelly-making business so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is from the Barangay of Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is 27 years of age, married and blessed with one child. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a business with Avon, a cosmetic dealer. Engaged in her business for five years already, Annalyn earns approximately PHP 3000 a month.

On December 21, 2008, Annalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan of PHP 5000 and is now requesting her fifth loan of PHP 7000 to be used as additional capital for her business.  Annalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for her children’s education, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul S., 57, is the leader of this group. Her kids are already adults and are capable to provide for their own expenses. Baktygul’s daughter works in a computer club, and her son is a constructor. Baktygul is divorced and the burden of running the business completely lies on her shoulders. Her son makes his best effort to help Baktygul in business. Their business of growing potatoes brought good results and her son decided to devote his entire time to farming also. They are currently growing only potatoes, but with the money received from this loan, she plans to start growing wheat. Baktygul believes that she will succeed in her business and help her children find their own paths in life. 

Jidegul A., 41. She has four children, the youngest is six years old. She is involved in growing clover. She applied for this loan in hopes of buying barley seeds and broaden her business. Soon she plans to arrange a wedding ceremony for her son and provide her children with high quality education.

Myskal T., 24, is a member of this group. She is divorced and has a five year old daughter. The purpose of Myskal’s applying for this loan is to purchase a refrigerator and soon perhaps an automobile. 

Nurgul M., 41, is married and has three sons. Her husband is a mechanic and she herself is planning to start engaging in cattle breeding. Nurgul hopes that this loan will help her to purchase cattle and broaden her business and get an automobile for her husband in the near future.

Tajihan hopes to get a loan in order to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers. She is planning to buy cattle for breeding.

Adalat M., 50, is divorced. She has 2 sons. Adalat together with her son is engaged in farming. A the present time they cultivate water-melon and cotton. They hope to get a loan in order to obtain onion seeds for cultivating.

Saadat S., 26, is married. Her husband earns money by working at the District Electric Power Station. The couple has 2 children. Both of them are of preschool age. The family make their living by farming; they cultivate onion and cucumbers to sell. Saadat needs to get a loan in order to rent a land for vegetable growing.

To make a living, Ernalyn makes and sells Filipino snack delicacies like biko and rice cakes. She also buys and sells a variety of vegetables. Ernalyn has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Ernalyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding the business, perhaps putting up a sari-sari store. This will be the fourth loan taken by Ernalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

He sees himself building apartments in five years. He has requested 80000 KES to open a mini-bakery.

The family raises money by breeding cattle and selling milk. From the profits, Kukun was able to afford to arrange her daughters’ weddings. Her loan purpose is to obtain a washing machine. In the future, she hopes to purchase a car for her son.

Djainagul D. is 54 and divorced. She has a daughter who is married and currently works in Russia. Djainagul earns her living by breeding cattle and selling milk. She hopes to obtain a loan in order to purchase a cow and coal for winter.

Marsina D., 44, is married. Her spouse is a builder. The couple brought up two daughters, both now married. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase coal.

loans.name: United Women For Development Group

texts.en:
Ruth Kabbeh, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women For Development. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 8 to 26 years. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a faithful woman.

For 5 years, she has been selling drinks (liquor) in Coca Cola Factory Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of drinks. Her dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 26 years old and a member of Kuendelea group in Faulu Kenya. He has been selling mosquito nets for one year. He also sells food for extra income. He does a part-time job as a musician and an instrumentalist. He hopes to develop a career as a musician in the future. He has requested for a first loan of KES 20,000 to buy a sewing machine, mosquito nets and maize and beans for cooking.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, mosquito nets and maize and beans for cooking.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Margarita es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Virgen del Carmen, convive con Francisco Lezme, juntos tienen un hijo de 3 años.
     
     Ella comenta que desde muy joven  empezó a trabajar con su macate (Venta ambulante de ropas al contado y a créditos) por que estudiaba y era la única forma de solventar sus estudios ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos y solo podía acompañar en los gastos de la casa, hoy en día ella trabaja por cuenta propia, con varios años de experiencia en el ramo y cuenta con  clientela formada.

       Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya  por la oportunidad que le brinda para acceder a un préstamo y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is from the city of Carapegúa located in the community of Virgen de Carmen. She lives with Francisco and together they have a three-year-old son.
    She says that ever since she was small she has worked in sales (as a roving salesperson selling clothes on lay away or credit). She did this because she was a student and this was the only way she was able to study. Her parents are poor and were only able to pay for the household expenses. Today she works for herself. She has many years of experience in the field and has a dedicated customer base. She is thankful for the Paraguayan Foundation for the opportunity they have provided for her by making available this loan. She promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: She will buy clothing such as jeans, blouses, shirts and other items.

loans.name: Ndiongolor Pintok Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NDIONGOLOR PINTOK est créé le 14 octobre 2010, jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de 36 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Bernadette D. tout à fait derrière et levant la main est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle a 49 ans,elle est mariée et a 9 enfants en charge,elle habite a Ndiongolor Pintok

Elle fait le petit commerce de mil et l'élevage de mouton depuis 7 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs CFA lui permettra de faire l'extension de son activité afin de réaliser des épargnes
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidien.
texts.en:
The Ndiongolor Pintok Banc Villageois was formed and inaugurated on October 14, 2010.  It is made up of 36 women, all from the same village.  They formed the group on the basis of proximity and affinity.

Bernadette D., in the back row with hand raised, is president of the Banc Villageois.  She is 49 years old and married with nine children in her care, and lives in Ndiongolor Pintok.  She has sold millet and raised sheep for seven years.

Her new loan of 50,000 francs CFA will allow her to expand her business activities in order to save money.  Her goal is to support her husband in covering daily expenses.

loans.use: loan will be used to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more meat, fish, salt, tomatoes, rice, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice A. is currently in the business of operating a small business selling beans and rice and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and rice to sell.  Joice is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a member of Quotet group in Faulu Kenya. She sells handbags for a living. She also does hair dressing for extra income. Currently, she doesn’t have a permanent business premise for hair dressing but she hopes to open a salon in the future. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access capital. She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more handbags.

loans.use: To buy more handbags.

loans.name: 72Nd Women Group

texts.en:
Mamai G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 72nd Women. She is 44 years old, widowed, and has eight children between the ages of 7 and 29 years. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to financial difficult.

For 12 years, she has been selling rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc. in 72nd Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc. She describes herself as a jovial woman whose goal is to build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Blessing is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en: Jenty R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Jenty is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 7 children and only 1 of her children goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, cooking oil, rice, beans, salt, seasoning, etc.

loans.name: Agenlina

texts.en: Agenlina A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Agenlina is 30 years old. She is married and her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and cassava and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour to sell. Mary is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more blouses and hand bags.

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.fr: Niwetu C. est  présidente du groupe Esther, âgée de 56 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants.  Son mari est  décédé depuis 1994. Tous ses enfants étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre. Elle vend des boissons, avec un dépôt relais de la société Bralima  (bière Primus, Fanta, etc.), plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers les années 2008. Elle vend ses produits a son domicile. Cependant dernièrement, son dépôt fut démoli par  la mesure administrative de maire de ville, concernant les constructions anarchiques dans la ville de Goma. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  20 casiers de Primus, Fanta, Mitsing. La cliente Niwetu C.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Esther est  composé de 18 femmes.
texts.en: Niwetu Chihimbu, the leader of the Esther group, is a 56-year old widow and the mother of six. Her husband passed away in 1994. All her children study, and some already have their own households. She launched this business with her own funding. She sells beverages through a distribution center of the Bralima company (Primus beer, Fanta etc); later on, she received a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima, around 2008. She sells out of her home. However, recently her distribution center has been demolished as per the mayor’s decision concerning unauthorized construction in Goma. This new loan will allow her to purchase 20 cases of beverages such as Primus beer, Fanta, Mitsing [Heineken's Mützig beer?]. As a client of Hekima, Niwetu Chihimbu is appreciative of its services to the poor who don’t have access to the traditional banking system. It remains to be mentioned that the Esther group is composed of 18 women.

loans.use: 20 cases of beverages such as Primus beer, Fanta,  Mützig beer

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: God Our Father Group

texts.en:
Ivy K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Our Father. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are between the ages of 2 and 16 years. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support. 

For 3 years, she has been selling bowls (dishes) in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 74,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bowls (dishes). She describes herself as a friendly and respectful woman whose dream is to improve her business.

IN THE PHOTO THAT ACCOMPANIES THIS PROFILE, MARY IS INSET AT LOWER RIGHT BECAUSE SHE WAS ABSENT DURING DISBURSAL.

loans.use: To buy more bowls (dishes).

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth A.  is currently in the business of operating a small business selling food stalls like yams, cassava, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more cassava to sell. Beth is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Night

texts.en: Night N., 20 years old, married, is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal for sale.  Her husband works as a driver.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes K. is 32 years old, married, with no children.  Her husband is a peasant.  Agenes is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal for sale.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 32 years old, married with 5 children.  Four of her children go to school, her husband is a business man.  Joice F. is currently in the business of selling onions and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes for sale.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando V. C. tiene 23 años, el vive en concubinato  y es padre de dos hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, él desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, porque fue padre a muy corta edad desde entonces la responsabilidad como padre hizo madurar y trabajar muy temprano, hoy en día el cliente es una persona muy responsable y trata de brindar una mejor vida a su familia, su esposa se dedica  a la venta de empanadas  y refresco, para tener un mejor ingreso y así poder ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos en su hogar, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Ivirgarzama,  donde esta mas de 6 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad y calidad del servicio. El sindicato les otorga paradas y turnos a cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is 23 years old. He has a spouse and two children that he helps and supports with their education. Since he was young he has worked in many different fields. He was a father at a young age. The responsibility of fatherhood has caused him to mature and go to work at an earlier age. Today he is a responsible person and he tries to provide the best that he can for his family. His wife sells empanadas (filled dough pastries) and sodas. In this way she makes money and is able to help with the household expenses. He works as a motor-taxi driver with the CARRASCO Company. He has worked in Ivirgarzama for the past six years. The service he provides is profitable because of the large quantity of customers that request his convenient and high-quality services. The company awards stops and turnabouts to each affiliate. These are located at different points in the city of Ivigarzama. The stops are located where customers need the taxi service. 
This is the first time that this customer has obtained a loan from our institution. He will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is finished with his current contract. This is a way that he can bring better service to his customers. In this way he can improve his earnings and thus improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: Working capital which will be used to buy a new tool for his work.

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en: Dudu Begernin is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, maize flour, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Dudu is 40 years old and married with a husband who works in business. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more maize flour to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and coffee at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Charity is 27 years old and married with a husband who is in business. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 47 years old, married and blessed with six children. He makes a living as a welder and metal fabricator, producing covers for doors and gates. He started this business in 1998 and, thanks hard work and help from Faulu Kenya, has been able to expand his small company. He hopes to open another location in the future, and has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy materials, such as iron sheets, that he needs to run his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as iron sheets

loans.name: Anrasiya

texts.en: Anrasiya A. makes a living selling charcoal at a local market and is applying for a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers. She is 35 years old and married to a businessman. The couple has four children, all of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, six and three years old.  She also supports two other dependents, and is paying for their education. In 2003, she established a business selling soft drinks and other beverages, soap and water. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to her family's income, and now works seven days a week, 11 hours a day. She has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell to her customers, and hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's schooling and open a savings account. She expresses her sincerest thanks to Kiva lenders who choose to support her by funding this loan.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
María de 23 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive con su esposo e hija en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil)

Realiza su trabajo sola para ayudar con los gastos familiares, una de sus hermana la inscribió como vendedora y hay fue cuando comenzó con esta actividad desde ese tiempo  trabaja  muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. 

Ella y su esposo quieren construir mejor su casa, por eso quieren comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, arena.  Productos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old. She sells Yambal products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to sell their products independently). She lives with her husband and daughter in Primavera de Duran (a semi-rural area on the outskirts of Guayaquil).
She does this work alone in order to help with the family’s expenses. One of her sisters signed up as a salesperson and since then she has been working as a salesperson. She goes to work very early and sells the products to her neighbors and friends. She sells perfume priced from $20.00 to $75.00 a bottle. 
Mary and her husband would like to build a better house. This is why she would like a loan to purchase building materials such as cement, blocks, and sand. In the future she would like to finish the construction on her house and give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, sand.

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 30 years old, married and has four children who range in age from two to seven. Three of her children are currently enrolled in school. Her husband makes a living selling soft-drinks and fish, and Clemantine contributes to the family's income by selling spare parts for bicycles. She has been in this business for eight years and has applied for this loan to buy more inventory to sell to her customers. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to take advantage of a sharp increase in bicycle usage in her area and a fast-growing demand for spare parts to keep them going.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 36 years old and a member of the Unity group in Faulu Kenya.  He is a married man with four children, aged 10, 7, 4 and 1. For a living, he runs a retail shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his finances well. With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy sugar, wheat, maize flour and cooking fat. He hopes to buy a piece of land so as to build his own house and to open another shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El señor Roger vive en casa de sus padres, quienes viven en anticretico en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; Roger es soltero, recien egresado del colegio, la actividad que realiza es el colocado de piercing en diferentes partes del cuerpo con un doctor que le paga por trabajo realizado. El crédito que solicita es para comprar un pupinel (máquina para hacer piercing) y realizar el trabajo independiente y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través  de Impro, pero por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Roger lives in his parents' house, which is a rental acquired through an "anticrético" agreement in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. Roger is single and recently graduated from school. 

His work is giving people piercings in various parts of the body. He works for a doctor who pays him per piercing. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a pupinel (a piercing machine) so that he can work independently and increase his income.

This is the first time he has asked for a loan from Impro, but his social character qualifies him to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Purchase a piercing machine to do his work independently

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
El Señor Filomena A. A. tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene dos hijo al cual ayuda y apoya en su educación, La clienta se dedica a la producción de banano y otros cultivos, en banano produce 240 chipas con un ingreso anual. La cliente cuenta con una experiencia como agricultor con más de 3 años experiencia la cual le ayuda a conocer bien el mercado donde se desenvuelve. La cliente entrega su producto a los comerciantes de los distintos mercados locales de la zona y comerciantes mayoristas que  venden sus productos a los diferentes mercados de las ciudades capitales. Dicha actividad económica no les alcanza para vivir cómodamente es por eso que la señora cuenta con otra actividad, comerciante de ropa al por menor, por lo cual necesita capital de operación para incursionar en esta actividad.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería, para contar con una variedad de productos y ponerlos a la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Filomena A. A. is 36 years old.  She is married and has two children whom she helps with their education.   She produces bananas and other crops.  One banana can produce 240 chips which augments her annual income.  Mrs. Filomena has over 3 years experience in agriculture which helps her understand the market where she works.  She delivers her produce to the tradesmen for each of the local markets in the zone.  The wholesale traders then sell the products to the different markets in the capital cities.  This economic activity doesn’t bring in enough to allow them to live comfortably, so she also works in clothing retail and for this, she needs working capital.

This is the first loan Mrs. Filomena has obtained from our institution.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise in order to have a variety of products to sell.

loans.use: Capital de operación, compra de mercadería

loans.name: Phebean

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Phebean. She is married and has three children aged 8, 14 and 18 years old. In the year 2000, Phebean established rice, beans, groundnuts and textiles business. She started her business because she never went to school and she needed to generate income to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 716,000SLL every month from this business. 
She needs a loan of 3,000,000SLL to buy more food stuff for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 136,040SLL. In the future, Phebean plans to educate her children through secondary and university level as well as expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more  clothings and foodstuffs

loans.name: Alba Dora

texts.es:
Alba Dora es una mujer viuda que tiene 4 hijos en las edades D. 23 a 44 años, ella inició su negocio desD. hace más D. 25 años, a través D. un préstamo familiar con el que compró algunos cosméticos y los vendió a crédito entre vecinos y miembros D. su familia. Con el paso del tiempo el número D. clientes aumentó  y empezó a diversificar sus productos,  así fue como incrementó sus utilidades con apoyo financiero D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ello sus condiciones D. vida y D. mejoramiento en su negocio, al que  ha logrado adicionarle vitrinas donD. exhibir sus productos, y ya no sale por las calles a distribuir sus mercancías, porque este punto D. ventas, le ha representado un poco D. descanso. Con esta organización ha logrado obtener 7 créditos y con su credikiva, comprará mercancía para surtir su vitrina y prepararse para la época D. fin D. año, en la cual sus ventas se incrementan en un 50%, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con papelería, paquetes D. regalos naviD.ños y  juguetes, ayudándole así a ganar más dinero.
Su meta principal es ampliar su negocio, adicionar nuevas vitrinas y ampliar su local, para hacerlo más confortable y con mayor capacidad D. venta. Con relación a su familia ayudar a sus nietos con una excelente educación; aunque Alba reconoce que  tiene un gran desafío y  es el D. ajustar sus gastos en las épocas,  ya focalizadas, en que las ventas disminuyen.
texts.en:
Alba Dora is a widow that has four children ages ranging between 23 and 44, she started a business more than 25 years ago through a family loan that she used to buy cosmetics and sold giving credit to her neighbors and family members.  As time went by, the number of clients increased and she started to diversify her products, this way she increased income and with the financial support of Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo she improved her life conditions and her business, she has been able to add a display area to showcase her products instead of going out the streets to distribute the merchandise, this has allowed her some rest.  With this organization she has been able to obtain seven loans and with her kiva credit she will buy merchandise to fill the display area and get ready for the holiday season in which her sales go up 50%, specially with anything related to paper, Christmas gift wrapping and toys, which helps make more money.

Her main goal is to grow the business, add new display areas and expand the area to make it more comfortable with more sales potential.  In regards to her family she helps her grandchildren achieve a great education, however, Alba recognizes that she has a challenge when it's time to adjust her expenses, already allocated when the sales go down.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to display on her store to get ready for the Holiday Season

loans.name: Baby  Remie

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Baby Remie.  She is married and has three children, aged 18, 15 and 9 years.   She also has three additional dependents.  In 2008, Baby Remie established her provisions and drinks business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,127,000 every month from this business.  Baby Remie would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more goods.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 157,780.  In the future, Baby Remie hopes to improve her family's standard of living. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
En  Caapucu- Cñia. Tape Guasu se formó el Comité San Cayetano integrada por 16 señoras muy trabajadoras y activas, y se se sienten muy bien dentro del programa. 
Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas. 
Buscan un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sandra L. quien se dedica a la venta de mercadería varias como colchas, sabanas, calzados,  cubiertos y otros a crédito y al contado.
Hace un buen tiempo que se dedica a esta actividad de venta el cual según ella le conviene mucho ya que con el ingreso que obtiene con esta actividad le ayuda a su familia, especialmente para la vestimenta y educación.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías, como sabanas, manteles, jeans, calzados y otros.
texts.en:
In Caapucu- Cñia. Tape Guasu a communal bank was formed called, Comité San Cayetano, made up of 16 very hardworking and active women, and they feel very happy to be in the program.

This group is very united and works well together, they don’t have any problems making their payments or among themselves.

They seek more help through the loan to contribute to their family’s income as well as improving their quality of life.

One of the members is Mrs. Sandra L., she sells various merchandize like bedspreads, sheets, shoes, eating utensils and other items on credit and paid in full.

For a long time, Mrs. Sandra has sold items and according to her it is very helpful since with the income that she gets from her work she helps her family, especially to buy clothing and provide her family with an education.

They need the loan to buy merchandize like sheets, tablecloths, jeans, shoes and other items.

loans.use: To buy merchandize.

loans.name: Momodu  Jang

texts.en:
26-year-old Momodu is married with no children.  In 2008, Momodu established his provisions, drinks and pure water business.  He began his business after his education because the job market was very tough and so he chose to start his own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,634,720SLL every month from this business as he always has consistent demand for his goods.  Momodu needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL to buy more provisions and drinks.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 147,125SLL. In the future, Momodu plans to help his wife attend a nursing course.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Augustus  Boisie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Augustus.  He is married and has no children.   He has three additional dependents, who live with him because one is in college and the other two are in secondary school and they need support from him. 

In the year 2000, Augustus began making soap from locally produced products. He began his business when he lost his job and believed doing the soap business could be a good source of income for him. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 826,400 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.

 Augustus requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and caustic soda to produce more soap. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 157,016 SLL.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and caustic soda for soap production

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel I. is 40 years old, married to Esther Indesia, and they have one child called Favour Ongotse  who is one year old. They live in the Mahanga area in Vihiga town.

Ezekiel is a tailor and has been in this business for the past two years. He has thus created a huge clientele. He needs to buy textiles for making clothes as he has orders from his clients. His monthly income comes to Kshs 14,000. He has high hopes, knowing that the loan will help him to make his business grow. 

His desire is to employ one person to help him run the business and to see it expand.

loans.use: Buy textiles to add to his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more spaghetti, tea, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 38 years old and is a single mother to four children: Josephine (19), Fredrick (15), Ageline (13) and Billy (11). She is from Kisumu.
Antonina has run a retail shop for the past eight years. She is applying for her third loan as she wants to buy 20 liters of salad oil, one sack of sugar, half a sack of rice and several crates of sodas. Her monthly income comes to 10,000 KES.
Antonina's desire is to have a big wholesale shop to supply both cereals and shop items at wholesale prices. She also hopes to purchase land to build a house for her children since she lives on her parent's homestead.

loans.use: To buy salad oil, sugar, soda and rice to add to stock

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: El alquiler D. lavadoras es el negocio que Elsy D. L. SaL. inició hace más D. 5 años y que en el en   2007, se propuso fortalecerlo con los créditos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque ya no alcanzaba a cubrir la demanda con solo 2 lavadoras que su esposo le había comprado para ese propósito.  Su negocio inició para satisfacer L. necesidades D. L. amas D. casa respecto a la disminución del esfuerzo y ahorro D. tiempo que requerían diariamente por este oficio que se torna agotador, sobre todo por el aguerrido sol D. la Costa Caribe, lugar donD. vieve Elsy. Ella cuenta con un triciclo en el que transporta sus màquinas,  tarea en la que le ayuda su hija mayor. Con el dinero generado por esta actividad Elsy ha logrado estudiar auxiliar D. enfermería y perfeccionarse mediante diplomados y estudios D. actualización, como el D. neonatal y muchos más. Su familia la conforman su esposo, empleado D. una empresa,  y sus 2 hijas en L. edades D. 15 y 10 años que aun estudian y sueña con verL. exitosas en sus profesiones futuras. Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización D. la que siente un gran apoyo, porque impulsó su negocio con capital D. trabajo y con su crecimiento ha constribuìdo con Elsy en su desarrollo personal. Ahora con su credikiva comprará dos lavadoras más para reponer L. primeras que compró,  que ya tienen un deterioro notorio y no aguantan el trajin diario. A sus 33 años Elsy con su familia caminan en la misma dirección para progresar, porque mientras su esposo y ella trabajan, sus hijas estudian y apoyan la gestión empresarial y del hogar, para algún día tener muchas más oportunidades D. éxito en su vida. Su principal desafío es el poco capital D. trabajo con el que cuenta y que es requerimiento para que su negocio continúe saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
More than five years ago Elsy D. L. SaL. started a business renting laundry machines. In 2007 she sought to strengthen her business with a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, as she was unable to meet customer demand with the two washing machines her husband had bought for that purpose.

She began her business to satisfy the needs of housewives regarding the reduction in effort and time savings of this tiring daily chore, particularly given the unrelenting sun of the Caribbean Coast where Elsy lives.

She has a tricycle she uses to transport her machines, a task in which she is assisted by her eldest daughter. With the income generated by this activity Elsy has been pursuing studies as a nursing assistant, perfected through graduate studies and updates, such as neonatal care and many other subjects.

Her family consists of her husband, employed by a company, and their two daughters aged 15 and 10 years who are still in school. She dreams of seeing them become successful in their future careers.

This is the second loan granted by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organisation that provided strong support, as it bolstered her working capital which contributed to Elsy’s personal development as the business grew.

Using her Kiva loan she will buy two more washing machines to replace the ones bought previously, which have deteriorated to the point where they can no longer withstand the daily grind. 

At 33 years of age, Elsy and her family are progressing in the same direction. While she and her husband work, their daughters study and help with the business and household tasks, so that one day they can have more opportunities for a successful life.

Her main challenge is the limited working capital she depends on and that is needed for her business to continue moving forward.

loans.use: buy two more washing machines

loans.name: Flora Mila

texts.es:
Flora de 56 años, hace decoraciones y vende bebidas y snack en una pequeña tienda, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). 

Hace años atrás ella vivía en una casa muy humilde casi metida en el agua de un estero, comenzó a trabajar con un congelador vendiendo bebidas, poco a poco con dedicación pudo completar dinero para arreglar su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda y trabaja haciendo adornos de telas, hilos. Trabaja en la tienda y en el tiempo que le queda o que no abre la tienda se dedica hacer las decoración que le piden desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para hacer mas decoraciones y tener un negocio establecido de decoraciones. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tene el negocio de decoraciones.
texts.en:
Flora is 56 years old and she makes decorations and sells refreshments and snacks in a small store. She lives in the Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban area, the majority of the inhabitants are informal merchants).

Some years back, she lived in a very humble home almost in a watery inlet. Flora began working with a freezer selling refreshments and little by little, with a lot of dedication, she was able to save enough money to improve her home. At the moment, she has a small store and works making decorations out of fabrics and thread. Flora works in the store and in the time that she has left or when she doesn’t open the store, she makes decorations which are ordered from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.

With the loan, Flora wants to buy fabrics to make more decorations and to have a business based on her decorations.

In the future Flora wants to improve her home and her decorating business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mohamed   G.

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Mohamed.  He is single and has 2 children, aged 11 and 10 years old.  In 2003, Mohamed established his second-hand electronics goods such as music sets, TVs, DVDs etc. sales business. He began his business after he dropped out of school; he believed this business could be a good source of income for him. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,303,000 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL.

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more electrical appliances for his electronics shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 460,600 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to rent a big store where he will be selling wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical items for his stall

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline O. is 27 years old, married to Wilfred Omollo, and they have two children, Quinter, four years old, and Brian Owino, one year old. They live in the Luanda area in Vihiga.

Caroline is a tailor and has been running her tailoring business for the past 10 years. Her clients mainly consist of people who live in her neighborhood and even school children as she makes school uniforms. She is applying for her 1st loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to us by a friend who is also a client. 

Her desire is to see her business expand and get many clients.

loans.use: Buy materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Nicholas Elisha

texts.en:
Nicholas Elisha O. is 44 years old, married to Teresa Atieno who is a business lady, and this also is a source of additional income for the family. They have four school-going children aged 12, 10, eight, and four years old respectively. Their residential place is in Eldoret-Kenya. He sells milk and also has a cereals shop as a secondary business; he has been in this business for 10 years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh.15,000.

Nicholas learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so he is applying for his fifth loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy three bags of rice, three bags of groundnuts, four bags of beans, and two bags of green grams. With the anticipated profits he plans to expand his milk and cereals business.

In future Nicholas wishes to have a pick-up to use for transportation. His deepest desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy three  bags of rice, three  bags of groundnuts, four  bags of beans,  and  two  bags of green grams (lentils)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, seasoning, peppers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, pepper, onions, salt, seasonings etc.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony O. is 26 years old and single. He is from Kisumu city and lives with his brother whom he pays fees for as he is still in high school.
Antony has been a carpenter for the past seven years and has seen his business grow. He is applying for his first loan as he wants to buy hardboard for making tables, cupboards, chairs etc. and this will enable him to meet customer demand. His desire is to have a big workshop in the town center so that he would be able to attract more customers since at the moment his business is situated in a hidden place.

loans.use: To buy hardboard for making tables, cupboards, chairs

loans.name: Loise Wambui

texts.en:
Loise has practiced farming in Njabini for the last eight years.  She is 42 years old, the single mother of two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In future, Loise hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Houghton B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Group'.  He is 30 years old, single, a college student and has two children who are 8 months and 15 years old. 

For 2 years, he has been operating a foreign exchange bureau on Duport Road outside Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to add more money to his business capital. He describes himself as a determined man whose goals are to improve his business and continue with his children's education.

loans.use: To add more money to his business capital

loans.name: Charles Kamau

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in Njambini town for the last six years.  He is 52 years old, married to Lucy Wanjiru, and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs to increase production.

In future, Charles hopes to embrace technology and farm in greenhouses to maximize his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs to increase production

loans.name: Samuel Waweru

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last five years.  He is 31 years old, married to Virginia Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy manure, fertilizer and potato seedlings.

In future, Samuel hopes to farm in greenhouses and also practice dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and potato seedlings

loans.name: Jeniffer Jebotip

texts.en:
Jeniffer Jebotip A. is 38 years old, married to Musa A. who is a farmer, and this is a source of additional income for the family. They have two children, aged six years and four years old. Their residential place is in Ngenyilen Eldoret-Kenya. She sells milk and has been in this business for the past six years with a monthly profit of Kshs.12,000.


Jeniffer learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her second loan of Ksh. 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy a cow. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand into the agriculture sector.

In future Jeniffer wishes to expand her business and support her family. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Carmen Giovanna

texts.es:
Carmen de 33 años, vive en el Guasmo  de Guayaquil, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).   

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos Yambal, trabajan con el código de la prima como vendedora oficial, cuando tubo capital compro productos para tener en stop. En la actualidad desde muy temprano ofrece los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. una de las preocupaciones que tiene es dejar solo a su hijo con su mama, mientras que sale a trabajar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener mas dinero para darle una mejor vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil.  She sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company which provides female entrepreneurs with the opportunity to make their own independent sales.

To help with her family's expenses she began selling Yambal products.  She works with her cousin's code as she is the official seller.  When she had enough capital she bought products to have in stock.  Currently, she offers products to her neighbors and friends from very early in the morning.  She sells perfume for $20.00 to $75.00.  One of her worries is having to leave her son alone with her mother while she goes out to work.

With her loan she would like to buy Yambal Products such as perfume, creams and deodorants. In the future she would like to be able to finish building her house and have rental rooms in order to have more money to provide a better life for her three children.

loans.use: Perfume, creams

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris Elizabeth C. R. es una comerciante de 52 años de edad, madre soltera de una hija de 17 años de edad, y junto a ella reside en el Barrio Guanaste en la municipio de San Esteban, Olancho. 

Desde hace veinte años doña Doris se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general y su Pulperia se llama Vecinos y Amigos, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y mientras ella se ocupa de cuidar el negocio y de los quehaceres del hogar, su hija se va al colegio.  Aprendió a trabajar gracias a que su padre le enseñó y ahora Doris está muy feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que este le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico con el cual ha podido mantenerse ella y su hija, y cubrir los gastos de los servicios públicos de su casa como el agua potable y la electricidad. Su dificultad es que en el barrio hay varios negocios del mismo tipo y eso provoca que las ventas bajen y en ocasiones los gastos escolares de su hija son altos y no tiene como pagarlos.  

Doris solicita el préstamo porque está construyendo su casa y necesita comprar materiales como: madera, bloques y bolsas de cemento, arena, varilla de hierro, y pagar mano de obra, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera ir terminando de construir poco a poco su casa y dentro de un tiempo cerC. pueda mudarse a ella. Su meta es trabajar y esforzarse cada día para que a su hija no le falte nada y también quiere ahorrar para que cuando su hija vaya a la universidad para hacerse profesional. Es su octavo ciclo en FAMA y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth C. R. is a 52 year-old merchant.  She is a single mother and has a 17 year-old daughter with whom she lives in the Guanaste neighborhood in the town of San Esteban, Olancho.

Doris has been selling groceries for twenty years and her grocery store is called 'Vecinos y Amigos' (Neighbors and Friends).  Her shop is open from 6.00am to 7.00pm and while she runs her business and does her housework, her daughter goes to school.  She learned to work because her father taught her and now Doris is very happy to have her own business since it has allowed her to have an income with which she can look after herself and her daughter and cover her household bills such as water and electricity. Her difficulty is that there are many businesses of the same type in the neighborhood and this means that sales drop.  Sometimes her daughter's school expenses are high and she has no way of paying them.

Doris is requesting her loan because she is building her house and needs to buy materials such as wood, blocks and bags of cement, sand and iron rods.  She also needs to pay workmen.  With the support of the loan she hopes to be able to finish building her house bit by bit and, in the near future, be able to move into it.  Her goal is to work hard every day so that her daughter does not want for anything.  She would also like to save so that her daughter can go to university and become a professional.  This is her eighth loan with FAMA.  With the financing she has obtained she has been able to improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Rubi inicia su ciclo 44 con 20 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios y pertenecen a la ciudad D. Huamanga.
Margoth es Presidenta del Bancomunal, tiene 23 años, es soltera y se dedica a la atención D. una cebichería, trabaja como mesera y cocinera en los horario D. 7am a 4pm,  pero tiene una dificultad es que no le pagan puntualmentesu salario mensual, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra D. abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, fideos, huevo, detergentes, jabón, galletas y demás dulces, etc, los cuales lo venD. en las ferias.
El sueño D. Margoth es poder tener su propia cebichería. Se siente muy feliz D. ser la presidenta y se ha propuesto que su Bancomunal sea modelo y que las socias sean puntuales en cuanto a la asistencia y pago.
texts.en:
The Rubi communal bank began their 44th loan with 20 members who have different businesses and belong to the city of Huamanga.
 Margoth is the president of the communal bank, she is 23 years old, single and works in a cebichería (place that sells ‘ceviche,’ marinated fish cocktails) she works as a waitress and cook. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. but she has problems since they don’t pay her wages on time. The loan is to buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, flour, spaghetti, eggs, detergents, soap, cookies and candies, etc. all of which is sold in fairs.
 Margoth’s dream is to have her own cebichería. She is very happy to be president and is committed to making her communal bank a model one, and that her fellow members be punctual in their attendance and payments.

loans.use: To buy groceries, rice, sugar, spaghetti, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Mayra Guadalupe es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 6 años, Ella empezó con este negocio, después de que unas amigas le enseñaran este medio de vida que es importante y sus mismas amigas le enviaban clientes para que practicara y se diera a conocer. Después fue ampliando su negocio, ya que ofrecía un buen servicio y los mismos clientes se encargaban de enviarles a otros clientes. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de polvos, faldas, pantalones, camisas y trajes. El sueño que tiene la señora, es ampliar su negocio que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Mayra Guadalupe is a single mother to 4 underage children who are under her care. She has a business selling clothing and makeup that is located in her home and as a street vendor. Mrs. Mayra began this business 6 years ago, after some friends taught her that this work was important and they also sent her customers so that she could practice and make herself known. Later, she began expanding her business, since it offered good service and the same customers sent her new ones. The loan by Mrs. Mayra is to buy face powders, skirts, pants, shirts and dresses. Her dream is to expand her business and to give her and her family more economic stability.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos Group

texts.es: Thalia tiene 18 años y vive en la zona C de Huaycán, está soltera y se desempeña de profesora, es la presidenta del nuevo grupo “Creciendo Juntos” el cual se conforma de vecinas-amigas, Thalia invertirá en bisutería este ultimo préstamo para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para sacar su especialización en educación, ella empezó su trabajo como auxiliar de educación  y le gusto tanto que decidió quedarse y ser profesora, espera terminar su carrera y seguir apoyando a su familia y pagar sus estudios por lo que espera que Edaprospo siga apoyando a ella en sus metas y a todo su grupo.
texts.en: Thalia is 18 years old and lives in the C zone of Huaycán.  Thalia is single and works as a teacher, she is the president of the new group, “Creciendo Juntos” (Growing Together) which is made up of neighbors-friends. Thalia will buy costume jewelry this loan will be used to help her family and to save to get her specialization in education, she began her work as an educational assistant and she liked it so much that she decided to become a teacher. Thalia hopes to finish her degree and to keep helping her family and to pay for her education which is why he hopes that Edaprospo (Kiva’s field partner) will keep helping her in her goals as well as the rest of the group.

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel N. T., tiene 59 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, vive en la zona de la Maica Sud  una zona periférica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona exclusivamente agrícola. Se encuentra casado, y por la edad que tiene, ya es abuelo, y solo viven con una de sus nietas que tiene 15 años. A quien cuidan y se encargan de hacerla estudiar; su nieta es la única compañera con la que cuentan.

El Sr. Angel y su esposa se dedica a la producción de leche cruda tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero, el con ayuda de su esposa ordeñan la leche todos los días, y ella se encarga de ir a venderla al mercado local y en el barrio casa por casa. Cada día produce unos 35 litros de leche diarios, los que los venden sin ningún problema, por las tardes se dedican al pastoreo y cuidados que requieran su ganado.

El Sr. Angel tiene el deseo de que su ultima nieta y compañera estudie una carrera técnica para que continúe y haga crecer la actividad que tienen, Aunque  ya antes tenía más cabezas de ganado pero, los regalo a sus hijos cuando se casaron, ahora se desea dejarle a su nieta igual.
El Sr. Angel solicito el crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero, para así cumplir con sus metas y brindarle a su nieta las facilidades cuando termine todos sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel N. T. is 59 years old and is involved in the production of milk. He lives in the Maica Sud area close to the city of Cochabamba, an area exclusively agricultural. He is married and with the age that he has he is a grandfather. He lives with his wife and with one of his granddaughters that is 15 years old, they take care of and make her study, she is the only companion that they have.

Mr. Angel and his wife are involved in the production of milk that they get from 3 dairy cows and with his wife’s help they milk them each day. His wife is in charge of selling the milk in the local market and in the neighborhood door to door. Each day they produce some 35 liters of milk, which they sell without a problem, in the evenings, they take the cows out to pasture and take care of whatever the cattle need.

Mr. Angel wants his youngest granddaughter and companion to study a technical degree to keep and continue the work that they do. Although he used to have more head of cattle but he gave them to his children when they got married and now he wants to do the same for his granddaughter.

Mr. Angel wants the loan to buy a dairy cow to meet his goals and to give his grandchild a good start when she finishes all of her studies.

loans.use: Operational capital, to buy semoviente (dairy cows)

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group 'Luchando contra la pobreza' 1 & 2 (Women Fighting Against Poverty). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children (both adults). She said her most difficult challenge was to be raised without her parents in a family home. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying working and cooking. She is part of the micro-finance program because she had the need to invest in her business when she found out about Esperanza and took it into her community almost 3 years ago.

Lucia is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza, and to lead the program structure in her community. She has had her business for around 10 years, starting after she sold some pigs she had raised. With the profits she started running her "colmado" (convenience store). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a "Colmado", a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those "colmado"s are in the neighborhood, a short walking distance from any home. Lucia will use the profits to have a better life, after she can finish building her house, and could have a successful business and good savings.

This Esperanza associate's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy depends on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, sugar, beans, and  3 gallons of oil

loans.name: Matilde Ines

texts.es:
Matilde Inés es una diseñadora gráfica que vive en la ciudad heroica de Colombia: Cartagena;  allí en su “Estudio Fotográfico Geraldin” se dedica a lo que más le gusta, tomar fotografías, hacer fotoshop, restaurar fotografías, diseñar, estampar y hacer montajes y todo lo que tiene que ver con el arte de la fotografía profesional; ella se las arregla para hacerle los mosaicos a estudiantes de colegios y universidades que terminan su fin de año , así mimo trabaja en los carnets de organizaciones educativas, estampados etc.
Como madre de dos niños en las edades de 10 y 13 años, Matilde ha logrado controlar su negocio, precisamente para poder brindarle una educación básica de calidad a sus hijos, para que un futuro se conviertan en profesionales exitosos; por eso todos en el barrio Daniel Lemaitre la conocen por su dinamismo contagioso y por su estilo de trabajadora persistente y disciplinada. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará material fotográfico, como lo es el papel, PVC, programa de diseño Pics, Porta carnets,  lectores de memoria, tarjetas, cintas e insumos para hacer de sus fotografías los más lindos recuerdos para las familias. 
Matilde dice que   desde hace 12 años realiza la actividad de fotografiar, pero  solo desde hace 7, adquirió equipos y enseres para trabajar mejor y con más tecnología;  sus principales  clientes son las familias que están ubicado en el barrio donde ella vive  y en sus alrededores, pero también son instituciones educativas de toda la ciudad, a quienes les ofrece los servicios de restauración de elaboración de carnets, fotografías del recuerdo, estampado de fotos, en fin todo lo que recuerde gratos o nostálgicos momentos del ser humano, por eso está siempre atenta respecto a las fechas de grados, primeras comuniones , en fin de cuanta reuniones familiar o social se inventen sus clientes. Su mayor desafio es adquirir un equipo de luces-flas y sombrillas, que ofrezcan una excelente calidad en las fotografias, asi como impresoras y laminadoras; Su sueño es poder viajar con sus hijas para que ellas conozcan toda Colombia y  reconozcan su pais como uno de los mas bellos  paisajes que Dios creò.
texts.en:
Matilde Inés is a graphic designer who lives in Colombia's heroic city of Cartagena. There, in the "Geraldin Photography Studio", she does what she likes best: use Photoshop, restore old photos, design, stamp and mount photos, and do all manner of other things that have to do with the art of professional photography. She arranges photos to make mosaics for high school and university students around graduation time. She also makes ID cards for educational organizations, does printing, etc.

As the mother of two children who are 13 and 10 years old, Matilde has been able to manage her business in order to give her children a high-quality, basic education, so that in the future they can become successful professionals. Everyone in the Daniel Lemaitre neighborhood knows her for her contagious dynamism and for her working style, persistent and disciplined. This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with her CrediKiva she will buy photography materials, including photo paper, PVC, design program, ID badge carrying cases, memory card readers, memory cards, tape and other necessary inputs to make her photos into the nicest possible memories for families.

Matilde says that for the past 12 years she has been taking photographs, but only 7 years ago did she acquire the equipment and gear to improve her work through better use of technology. Her main clients are the families who live in and around the neighborhood, as well as educational institutions from all over the city, for whom she makes ID cards, photographic memorabilia, photo printing, really everything that recalls a human being's pleasant or nostalgic moments in life. This is why she always pays close attention to dates of graduation, first Communions, and other social and family reunions that her clients invest in. Her greatest challenge is to buy a flash lighting system and umbrellas to give her photos higher quality; she could also use better printers and laminating machines. Her dream is to be able to travel with her daughters so that they can get to know all of Colombia and realize that their country is one of the most beautiful created by God.

loans.use: Buy materials for photography, including photo paper, PVC, design program, ID badge carrying  case, memory card readers, memory cards, tape and other necessary inputs to make her photos into the nicest possible memories for families

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
La  Señora Nicolaza V. Muñoz tiene 33 años madre soltera tiene 2 hijos menores dependientes y la madre que tiene 61 años viven en sector de Aguirre está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Doña Nicolaza V. Muñoz es agricultor produce papa, haba, avena forrajera en su terreno que tiene 1.2 hectáreas, también tiene ganado vacuno, es una persona humilde pero trabajadora,  necesitaba dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico y semilla de papa porque el capital que tenia ha gastado en la curación de sus madre que padece de una enfermedad gastritis, para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad y les piden muchos requisitos.
 
Pero se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona y ofertar crédito, la Sra. Nicolaza V. Muñoz está muy contenta de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora comprara los insumos agrícolas para sembrar, así recuperara su capital y poder ahorrar dinero para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos. La Sra. Nicolaza esta feliz porque podra comprar al abono y las semillas que estaba ncesitando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolaza V. Muñoz is 33 years old and a single mother to two dependent children. She also takes care of her 61-year-old mother. She lives in the Aguirre area, located 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Mrs. Nicolaza V. Muñoz is a farmer and produces potatoes, beans, and oats on her 1.2-hectare plot of land. She also has cattle, and is a humble but hard-working person. She needed money to buy agricultural inputs, like organic fertilizer and potato seeds, because she spent the money she had on her mother's gastritis treatments. It is very difficult for Nicolaza to go to banks in the city, since they ask her for many requirements. 

She did, however, take the initiative to travel to that area and offer loans. She is very pleased to have received this loan, and she will now buy seeds in order to earn the money back and save money so that she can send her two children to school. Nicolaza is happy to finally be able to buy the fertilizer and seeds she needed.

loans.use: Buy agricultural inputs (seeds and fertilizers)

loans.name: Tomas Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas es una persona responsable que ayuda a su Mamá ya que por su avanzada edad necesita el apoyo, el es el único de sus hijos que esta soltero para ayudarlo ya que todos tienen familia propia y no viven cerca de ella, el  es propietario de  la movilidad con la cual trabaja responsablemente   en un radio taxi desde hace tiempo el tiene ganas de superarse y continuar estudiando y trabajando también ya que hace poco tiempo tuvo su pareja y no funciono la relación no tienen hijos y por esta razón decidieron darse  de tiempo. El necesita el préstamo para el cambio de caja automática  a caja mecánica ya que tiene ventajas para  el propietario en cuanto al costo que esto implica  razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Tomas is a responsible person who helps his mother, since due to her advanced age she needs his support. He is the only one of her children who is still single, and his siblings all have families of their own and live far from their mother. Tomas owns the car, which he has been driving responsibly as a radio taxi for some time now. His goal is to get ahead in life and continue his studies while he works. He was recently in a relationship but it didn't work out, they decided to take a break since they don't have any children together. He needs this loan in order to change from an automatic transmission to a manual transmission, since there are certain cost savings that come with having a manual transmission. This is why he is requesting a Kiva loan.

loans.use: Switch taxi from automatic to manual transmission

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Cristian, de 27 años, es el 4to de 9 hermanos,  vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus hermanos menores. Desde muy pequeño apoyó a sus padres en el cultivo, pero cuando migró a la ciudad tuvo que dedicarse a varios oficios para subsistir, es así que logra comprarse un motocarro; que gracias al aporte que le dio la familia pudo obtener su vehículo, ahora trabaja sin cesar ofreciendo el servicio de transporte al público. Es de esta manera que se gana la vida y le va muy bien, ya que cobra de acuerdo a la distancia en que lleva casa pasajero, además la amabilidad con que los atiende le ha hecho merecedor de su confianza y estima de ellos. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente, sin embargo hay momentos en que su vehículo se malogra, perjudicándole así continuar con su trabajo, por ello necesita darle un mantenimiento mecánico. Con el tiempo, desea comprarse otra moto carro, para alquilar y así captar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de toda su familia. Ingresa a su sexto crédito con MFP, y se siente muy contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo va invertir en la compra de repuestos para su moto carro, ya que desde hace un año que no le da mantenimiento.
texts.en: Cristian, 27, is the forth of 9 siblings. He lives with his parents along with his younger siblings. Ever since he was very little, he has helped his parents farming, but when they migrated to the city, he had to engage in various trades to survive. From this work, he managed to buy a rickshaw motor-scooter. He now works constantly offering shuttle service to the public. This is how he makes a living and he is doing very well, as he charges according to the distance the passenger's home. His serves with kindness which has earned his customers trust and appreciation. What he likes about his job is that he gets to meet many people. Yet there are times when his vehicle breaks down, which jeopardizes his work and requires mechanic maintenance. Over time, wants to buy another vehicle to rent to another driver to make more profits for the welfare of his family. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he feels very happy to work with his community group. With this loan request, he will invest in buying motor parts for his vehicle which he has not done maintenance on for over a year.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Solidarity Group

texts.es: La señora Amparo Nicolaza y Aurora Elena conforman el grupo solidario Sagrada Familia. Esta no es la primera experiencia que tienen juntas con créditos. Pues han sido muy luchadoras y trabajadoras  Amparo que se dedica a al destace de cerdo, tiene 51 años pues lo inicio por cuenta propia ya que ha dedicado mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio  desde hace 20 años, que se dedica a este negocio y sus clientes siempre llegan a comprar cerdo, ya que ella ha brindado una buena calidad de carne de cerdo. Ellas actualmente están solicitando un préstamo para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, los cuales a la fecha son bastantes. Pues ha sido muy importante mejorar sus negocio para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
Ms. Amparo Nicolaza and Ms. Aurora Elena make up the Sagrada Familia ["Holy Family"] solidarity group.  This is not their first experience taking out a loan together, as they have long struggled and worked hard.  Amparo is a pig butcher.  She is 51 years old and started her business on her own.  She has put a great deal of effort and sacrifice in over the 20 years she has had this business.  Her customers consistently come to buy pigs, as she has always offered a good quality of pig meat.

These women are requesting a loan at this time in order to meet orders from their customers, which currently number quite a few.  Improving their businesses has been very important for the well-being of their families.

loans.use: to fill customers' orders

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.en:
Léonie is a leader of the community bank named “Développement Plus” which is composed of 20 micro-entrepreneurs, united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.
