Léonie sells plantain bananas at a market located in the western area of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1989. Her beginning capital was US$ 50. Currently, through her sales, Léonie makes about US$ 35 per week. Her plans are to use the next loan to purchase some stalks of plantain bananas to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having eight times received and properly repaid loans. She dreams of one day opening a supermarket in her area. Léonie is 46 years old, married and a mother of four children whose ages are between 8 and 14. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some stalks of plantain bananas to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Naomi Adjoa Essoun

texts.en:
Naomi Adjoa Essoun A. sells provisions. Naomi has been through junior high school.  She is married and lives together with her children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to educate her children with the additional income which will be generated from the loan.

In this photograph, Naomi is standing infront of her provision cage with some few provisions on display.

loans.use: buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: José Salomón

texts.es: José Salomón se dedica a la venta y elaboración de mochilas. El tiene cierta experiencia en créditos pues su experiencia ha sido muy gratificante. El tiempo que tiene con este negocio es de 16 años pues no ha sido fácil ya que ha tenido muchos retos que superar. Inicio a este negocio por su familia ya que su Papa le había enseñado este medio de vida, para que ganara algo de dinero y pudiera mantener a su familia, pues siempre se ha encargado de llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como cuero, tela, zipper, agujas.  Pues actualmente tiene varios pedidos que realizar para sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Salomón works making and selling backpacks. He has some experience with loans and it has been very rewarding. He has working in this business for 16 years but it has not been easy because he has had many challenges to overcome. José began the business through his family because his father had taught him the trade so that he would earn money and could support his family. He has always been responsible for bringing the daily bread to his home.

This loan is for the purchase of raw material such as leather, fabric, zippers, and needles because he has several orders to make for his customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Proposito 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the group named 'Mujeres con Propositos' 2 & 3 (Women with Purpose). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Puerto Plata, a community with unreliable electricity and water services. The community does not have access to some basic services like trash collection.

Lidia is a mother of five children, of whom two still live at home together with her long-term partners. This will be Lidia's third loan with Esperanza. She has successfully repaid two loans of increasing amounts and wants to use this loan to buy different products for her miscellaneous sales business. She plans to buy perfumes, body lotion, cosmetic products, bed linens and others. She hopes to continue to grow her business with this loan.

Lidia has been able to provide for her children and improve what she can provide for them since receiving loans from Esperanza. She has also used her profit to save, because she wants to have a locale for her business, and be successful. In this way she hopes to make her dreams come true, which are to give her children the opportunity to have everything she didn´t, for example attend the university and have their own home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body lotion, cosmetic products, bed linens, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Rosario

texts.es:
Vilma de 56 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). Tiene un local de reciclaje que comprar y vende. 

Hace 10 años comenzó con el negocio de reciclaje con la idea y ayuda de uno de sus hijos pudo mejorar la recolección de botellas, tachos, cartones, etc. Poco a poco fue dividiendo los sectores donde recolectaba. En la actualidad trabaja con la ayuda de su hijos recolectando y clasificando desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. En las horas libre que tiene se dedica a confeccionar ropa con una maquina de coser que tiene en su casa.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y tachos para ubicar los reciclajes. En el futuro quiere mejorar el lugar donde tiene las cosas reciclada.
texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and lives in El Guasmo in Guayaquil, an area characterized by the fact that the majority of its residents are informal merchants. She has a recycling business in which she buys and sells.

She began with the recycling business ten years ago with the idea and the help of one of her children. She was able to improve the collection of bottles, containers, cardboard, etc. Little by little, she began dividing the sectors where she collected. She currently works with the help of her children, collecting and sorting from 9am to 6pm every day. In the free time that she has, she makes clothing with a sewing machine that she has in her house.

With the loan, she wants to buy fabrics and containers for identifying the recycled materials. In the future, she wants to improve the area where she has the recyclables.

loans.use: Fabrics, supplies.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a widow. She takes care of seven dependents. She has not been formally educated. Abena is into the sale of charcoal and cassava at Elmina.  The charcoal is usually measured and bagged in a black polythene bag. Abena will add her loan to her initial capital to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.  Abena plans to educate her dependents with the added income which will be generated from the loan.

To the left of A. are some bags of charcoal. In her hand also is a sample of how the charcoal is bagged.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Encanto Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento ENCANTO esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: la presidenta del grupo  es la señora Gregoria, se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, desde hace 6 años, su familia esta compuesta de su esposo y nueve hijos de los cuales cinco ya son casados y cuatro viven con ella de los cuales siguen estudiando. El monto que solicito es para comprar  de refrescos.  
El tesorero del grupo es don Cristian, se dedica al transporte en la línea de taxi trufi  hace 4 años, su familia esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijo que tiene un año de edad.  El monto que ha solicitado es para la compra de algunos repuestos para su movilidad. 
La secretaria del grupo es la Sra. Jiovana, que se dedica a la venta de comidas en su domicilio desde hace 2 años, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos que dos de ellos estudian y una es bebe todavía. El monto que solicito es para la compra de una cocinilla que arde más fuerte y con más hornallas.
Todas las socias del Banco Encanto son personas trabajadoras y muy responsables con muchas ganas de superación.En la fotoa estan 11 personas ya que dos de las socias vinieron acompañadas.
texts.en:
The Encanto communal bank is comprised of the following board of directors: The president of the group is Gregoria, who has worked selling food and drinks for six years. Her family consists of her husband and nine children, five of which are already married and four of them live with her and continue in school. The loan requested is to purchase refreshments.

The treasurer of the group is Cristian who has worked in transportation with a trufi (a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops) for four years. His family consists of his wife and 1-year-old son. The loan that he has requested is for the purchase of some spare parts for his vehicle.

The secretary of the group is Jiovana and she has worked selling food from her home for two years. Her family consists of her husband and three children, two of which are in school and one is still a baby. The loan she has requested is for the purchase of a stove that burns stronger and has more burners.

All of the members of the Encanto communal bank are hardworking and very responsible people with a lot of desire to overcome. There are 11 people in the photo because two of the members came with someone.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments and a stove

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha Lucia es una joven de 27 años que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, ella es muy ingenioniosa por naturaleza, por eso fue que cuando su tío le propuso que vendiera yogurt, mediante el sistema de distribución enseguida accedió y lo primero que hizo fue capturar el mercado de empleados de la empresa donde trabaja su conyuge y gradualmente se ha extendido en el barrio. Pero como ella no se queda quieta también empezó a analizar sus mejores clientes y le está ofreciendo calzado femenino y ahora se mueve entre sandalias, que son las que usualmente usan las mujeres especialmente en los alrededores de la Playa. Con estos dos negocio ha logrado aumentar los ingresos de su hogar y pues  quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, porque el suyo está representado en las cuentas por cobrar; con su financiamiento comprará calzado preparándose para la temporada de fin de año que se avecina y también  yogures que tiene encargados por docenas, porque en un futuro quiere convertirse en una proveedora importante en otros sectores de la ciudad donde aun no ha llegado.
Su mayor desafío  es saber administrar es el pequeño capital con el que cuenta que es producto de sus ahorros y que gradualmente quiere aumentar aplicando inyecciones de capital de trabajo a su negocio, como hasta ahora lo está haciendo.
texts.en:
Martha Lucia is a 27-year-old living in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and their two children. She is by nature very ingenious, so when her uncle proposed that she sell yogurt through the distribution system, she immediately agreed and the first thing she did was to obtain the market for employees at her husband’s place of work, and gradually extended her business through the neighbourhood.

As she is always looking for opportunities she analysed her best customers, and began offering women’s footwear. Currently she is moving towards sandals which is what women usually wear, especially around the beach area.

With these two businesses she has managed to increase her household income and now wants to increase her working capital which shows up in her accounts receivable.

With her loan she will buy footwear in preparation for the impending year-end season, and also yogurt which she stocks by the dozen. In the future she wants to become a major provider for other parts of the city where she has not ventured until now.

Her greatest challenge is to manage the modest capital at her disposal through savings. She wants to gradually increase the insertion of working capital into her business as she has been doing until now.

loans.use: yogurt which she stocks by the dozen and footwear

loans.name: Isidoro Martin

texts.es: El señor Isidoro Martin tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de sal, inicio por cuenta propia y buscando una fuente de ingresos, el cual vende sal por quintal el cual vende en otros municipios. El se encuentra muy alegre con este financiamiento que ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, con ella ha podido ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. Este financiamiento será destinado para la compra de sal por quintal.
texts.en: Señor Isidoro Martin is 41 years old, married and has three young children. He works buying and selling salt. He started with his own funds and is looking for other sources of income. He sells his salt in sacks of 100lbs to other municipalities. This financing would make him very happy as it would demonstrate that he is a very responsible person. He has been dedicated to this humble activity for 10 years with which he can offer his children an education, food and clothing. This loan will be used for the purchase of 100lb salt sacks.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es:
El señor Sotero es viudo ya hace varios años, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa propia, en la zona Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente cuenta dos puestos de venta, en uno de ellos vende relojes y en el otro cuenta con una persona que le colabora en la venta de ropa interior, en la zona el Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadería (relojes y ropa interior) en cantidad y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sotero has been a widower for several years. He has two children who are in school. He lives in his own home in the Alto Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He has two points of sale, one in which he sells watches and the other which he runs with a partner to sell undergarments, in the Rosario area of the city of La Paz. This is how he obtains income for his household. 

The loan he is requesting is to purchase merchandise (watches and undergarments) in bulk and thus increase his income.

This is his second loan and the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase watches and undergarments for his sales business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. has a table on which she displays bread, biscuits and other items for sale at Elmina.  Comfort has acquired junior high level of education.  She has seven dependents. Her loan will be used to buy various sorts of biscuits for sale. She plans on reinvesting her profit in her business.

loans.use: buy bread and various biscuits for sale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es comerciante informal de ropa y electrodomésticos, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Empezó con el dinero que le otorgo la empresa donde trabajaba, compro mercadería como electrodomésticos y ropa para vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano recorriendo las calles para vender la ropa y los electrodomésticos. Una de las dificultades es que no tiene un vehiculo disponible y tiene que recorrer lugares peligrosos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropa, electrodomésticos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere  tener una papelería para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is an informal merchant of clothes and electronic appliances.  He lives with his wife and two kids in Guasmo of Guayaquil ( a place characterized by its predominant population of informal merchants).

He began with funds given to him by the company where he works at; he purchased merchandise like electronic appliances and clothes to sell to his friends and acquaintances.  He works alone and starts very early roaming the streets to sell clothing and electronic appliances.  His problem is that he doesn't have a vehicle and he has to cover dangerous territory.

With this loan, he would like to purchase more merchandise like clothing and electrical appliances for the business.  In the future he would like to start a stationery for his kids.

loans.use: Clothing and electronic appliances

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia, de 60 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de los 7 hijos que tiene. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Mala; Hortencia se dedica a vender sus cosméticos, yendo de casa en casa a colocar el producto. Con el tiempo se ha convertido en una excelente vendedora, logrando así estabilizar su negocio y percibir buenas rentas.  Uno de sus objetivos es procurar hacer una lista de pedidos, cuanto más es el pedido mayor para ella es la ganancia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es orientar a sus clientes sobre el uso de cada producto que vende, de esa manera sus clientes le tienen mayor confianza. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo, aunque tenga que caminar, pero no le importa con tal de poder vender la totalidad de productos que ofrece. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar más su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Es su  sexto crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. Asimismo esta feliz, de pertenecer a su banco comunal, por que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables. Con el crédito solicitado, desea comprarse una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza.
texts.en: Hortencia is 60 years old,she has a very loving and hard-working family, she is married, and lives in her home with the 2 youngest of 7 children.  Hortencia walks the streets in the city of Mala selling her cosmetic products door-to-door.  In time she has become an excellent salesperson and has managed to stabilize her business and retain good income.  One of her objectives is to make a list of orders; the larger the order the more she earns.  What she likes most about her job is being able to advise her clients on the proper usage of the products she sells, this way her clients learn to trust her.  She enjoys her work despite having to walk, but she doesn't mind as long as she sells all the product she offers.  With time, she would like to expand her business and finish building her home.  This is her 6th loan with MFP and she will continue to be punctual with her payments since she plans on obtaining future loans.  She is happy to be a part of the communal bank because all of its members are very responsible.  With this loan she wishes to purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la enseñanza a niños del nivel primario, ella es profesora y enseña desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para gastos personales para que compre lo que necesite. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank, "QORIWASI" located in the district of Cusco and belonging to the Cusco province.

This member's name is Dina, she is 49 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities between teaching from 8AM to 1PM to elementary aged children and wanting to own a grocery store.  She needs this loan for personal expenses and be able to purchase what she needs.

She thanks those who make up part of this dream through this medium and commits herself to making timely payments.

loans.use: Loan will be used for personal expenses.

loans.name: Serwah

texts.en:
Serwah K. is divorced and has four children. Serwah smokes fish for sale at Elmina. Serrah uses the income she makes from her sales to educate her children. 

She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy more fish to process (smoke) for resale. She anticipates using the increase in income as a result of the loan to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more fish to process (smoke) for resale

loans.name: Agnes Araba Mansah

texts.en: Agnes Araba Mansah K. is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has no formal educational background. She sells porridge made from rice at Elmina. This rice dish is most often served with milk, sugar, boiled or fried eggs, and bread. She is asking for the loan to purchase more rice, milk, and other items to cook for sale. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes wishes to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase more rice, milk and other items to cook for sale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra.Miriam; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias y también es ama de casa y le gustaría que sus hijos salgan profesionales,la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para gastos familares para la educación y mantención de sus hijos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “QORIWASI” communal bank. It is located in the district of Cuzco, province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Miriam. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of 3. She is a housewife and she would like for her children to have professions. She wants to have a grocery store. She is asking for the loan for family expenses and for the education and support of her children.  

This member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is commited to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan for family expenses for the education and support of her children.

loans.name: Erik Bruno

texts.es: El Sr. Erik, cliente que vive en la ciudad de La Paz en la zona de Tembladerani ,  la casa donde vive es de la suegra, La Sra. Antonieta, el Sr. No esta casado pero convive con la señora Evelin con la cual tuvieron una nena que en la actualidad tiene 4 años de edad. Don Erik se dedica a la venta de DVD(s) y doña Evelin a la venta de comida en las construcciones lleva con esta actividad un año y medio teniendo un mercado ya estable,  de esta manera los dos contribuyen a los gastos  de la familia. El crédito será destinado para la compra DVDs de musica Navideña villancicos y peliculas navideñas ya que se esta acercando la fecha de navidad, y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos, la pareja es muy trabajadora y muy activa siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, es Sr. Erik esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en: Erik is a client who lives in the city of  La Paz in the Tembladerani area. The house he lives in belongs to his mother-in-law Antonieta. He isn't married, but lives with Evelin and they have a daughter who is now 4. Erik sells DVDs and Evelin sells food at construction sites. He has been doing this activity for a year and a half and has a stable market now. In this way, he contributes to the family expenses. The loan will be used to buy DVDs with Christmas-themed music and movies, since Christmas is coming soon, and in this way he will increase his income. The couple is very hardworking and active, always thinking about their family's wellbeing. Erik is very grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To buy DVD por cantidad

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 25 years old and married with three children between the ages of two and seven. All of her children go to school. Esperance sells potatoes. She has had her business for seven years and her husband works with her. With this loan she will buy more potatoes to sell and she will buy a cow with her profits. Esperance says that her business is successful because of the large number of clients she serves. In the future she would like to buy a truck to supply potatoes to the capital city.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Cecilia Ama

texts.en: Cecilia Ama E. sells foodstuffs such as fresh tomatoes, onions, and other items at Elmina.  She has attained junior high level of education.  She is married to a security man and has four children. The loan she hopes to get will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Jessenia America

texts.es:
Jessenia es comerciante informal de ropa y electrodomésticos, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Empezó hace tres años atrás invirtiendo sus ahorros compro mercadería como electrodomésticos y comenzó a vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano recorriendo las calles para vender la ropa y los electrodomésticos. Una de las dificultades es que no tiene un vehiculo disponible y tiene que recorrer lugares peligrosos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar electrodomésticos y sabanas para poder surtir mas sus ventas y que sus clientes tengan mas variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener mas rutas de ventas para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessenia is an informal seller of clothing and home electronics appliances.  She lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil (a place characterized by residents that are mostly informal merchants).  

She started out three years ago, investing her savings and buying merchandise such as electronic appliances that she began selling to friends and acquaintances.  She works alone, from very early in the morning, to sell her clothing and appliances.  Some of the difficulties she faces are not having a vehicle available, and having to travel through dangerous areas.  

She wants to use the loan to buy appliances and bed sheets, in order to make more sales and so her customers have a greater variety to choose from.  In the future, she would like to have additional sales routes in order to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase electronic appliances and clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Theresa Aba Atom

texts.en: Theresa Aba Atom N. bakes bread at Elmina. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a security man. She has junior high educational background. Theresa assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. She is requesting the loan to buy more ingredients to bake bread for distribution. The additional income she generates will be used to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to use to bake bread for distribution

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna, de 26 años, es una madre de familia muy  trabajadora, es separada, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus dos hijos. Jovanna, se dedica al cultivo de higos, mangos, paltas y manzanas en la chacra de sus padres; que con la ayuda de sus hermanos, puede cosechar toda su producción en menor tiempo. Durante el verano, los frutos que más se desarrollan son los higos y mangos, siendo trasladados al mercado mayorista de frutas de Lima. Es así que tiene 4 años realizando esta labor y considera que le gusta sembrar y cuidar y hacer lo posible que mayor productividad, ya que de las ganancias que perciba podrá cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. En adelante, continuará vendiendo su producción y aumentar sus rentas, con el tiempo desea construir su propia casa, de ese modo mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo comunal,  es una socia muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su grupo, de ahí que la nombraron como presidenta. Con el crédito solicitado, pagará la mano de obra para que le ayuden a limpiar el terreno de la maleza y preparar la tierra para si próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jovanna is 26 years of age and a hard-working mother.  She is separated and living in her parents’ house with her two children.  Jovanna dedicates herself to growing figs, mangoes, avocadoes and apples on her parents’ farm.  With help from her brothers, she can harvest all of her production in less time.  During the summer, the fruits she grows most are figs and mangoes, which are then transferred to the wholesale fruit market in Lima.  She has been carrying out this activity for 4 years.  She enjoys planting and tending to her crops in order to yield the greatest possible production, since her earnings allow her to cover her children’s educational expenses.  In the future, she will continue to sell her product and increase her earnings.  Over time, she would like to build her own house in order to improve her children’s standard of living.  

This is her sixth credit with MFP and she will continue to be punctual with her installment payments.  She is a responsible member of her cooperative group, always concerned for the well-being of the members, which resulted in the group nominating her as its president.  She will use the requested loan to pay for manual labor to help clean up her land and prepare it for the next planting.

loans.use: To pay for manual labor to help her clean her land and get it ready for the next planting.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Silvestrina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Fe y Esperanza 1 & 2 (Women of Faith and Hope). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Silvestrina’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic in an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry. Outside of the all-inclusive resorts, potable water and electricity are unreliable.

Silvestrina lives in a simple structure with her husband and some of her six children. For the past two years, she has run a Colmado, a place that sells all of the ingredients to cook daily food. Colmados are generally integrated into neighborhoods and a short walk from many homes. Silvestrina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business which started out selling salad. Silvestrina will use her loan to buy rice, flour, and other foods. She will use the profits to continue studying and expand her technical abilities to baking and sewing. Silvestrina wants to save money because, even though her children are not living in her house, she feels the need to help and support them anytime.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, and other foods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth Asana Mohammed

texts.en: Elizabeth Asana Mohammed D. is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason.  She operates a food joint at Elmina where she cooks a variety of dishes to sell. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. In this photo, Asana is peeling cassava to get ready for cooking.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias y también es guía de turismo donde viaja a diferentes lugares guiando a turistas, la socia quiere tener una agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORIWASI” cooperative bank, located in the district of Cusco.  

Her name is Sonia, she is 43 years old, and the single mother of 1 son.  She alternates her daily activities, and is also a tourist guide traveling to different areas to lead tours.  She would like to have a travel agency.  

She is requesting this loan to do some repairs to her home.  She thanks everyone who may take part in this dream of hers via this medium, and commits to repaying the loan in the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Alberto de 36 años de edad y residente de San Jacinto, municipio ubicado en del departamento de Bolívar,  tiene un negocio no muy tradicional: está dedicado a la apicultura,  y también compra cerdo y carnero en pie que vende en canal; así sacrifican al animal,  retirando su piel, vísceras patas y cabeza para luego  pesarla y venderla por libras;  Miguel inicialmente se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la ganadería en los Montes de María, donde históricamente aprendió este oficio, pero la situación que se vivió hace mas de 10 años, lo obligó a salir de sus tierras, a las que hace tres años regresó, pero para dedicarse a la apicultura con unos amigos y también a la venta de carnes ya que cuenta con una clientela en el municipio de San Jacinto.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con una parte de él,  comprará cerdo y carnero, alimentos que usan mucho las amas de casa para la preparación de su comidas especiales en esta navidad y año nuevo y que aumentará  sus demanda en esta época; con la otra parte del crédito comprará materiales para las colmenas productoras de miel, como marcos, láminas de cera, cajas y techos para sus cultivos de abejas.
Su sueño junto a su cónyuge, es educar a sus hijas,  que en la actualidad tienen 6 y 12 años,  para que en un futuro sean unas profesionales exitosas y continuar ensanchando su negocio hasta lograr buenas utilidades que le permitan  tener su casa propia y  bienestar  familiar.
texts.en:
Miguel Alberto is 36 years old and a resident of San Jacinto, a municipality located in the department of Bolívar.  He has a very traditional business:  he is dedicated to beekeeping, and also to buying pigs and cows to then sell in parts.  The animal is sacrificed, removing the skin, viscera, hooves and head, to later weigh and sell per pound.  Miguel initially dedicated himself to farming and raising livestock in the Montes de María, where he learned the trade.  The situation he faced obligated him to leave his lands, to which he returned three years ago, but to instead tend to bees with some friends and to sell meats as he has a customer base in San Jacinto.

This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With part of the loan, he will buy pigs and cows, foods that homemakers use a great deal to prepare special dishes for this coming holiday season.  He will use the other part of the loan to buy materials for honey producing beehives, such as frames, sheets of wax, boxes, and roofs.  His dream, and that of his wife, is to educate their daughters who are currently 6 and 12 years old, so that they can have a successful future as professionals.  He would also like to continue growing his business until he earns enough to have his own house and for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Partially to buy pigs and cows, and partially to buy beekeeping materials such as frames, sheets of wax, boxes and roofs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 32 years old and married with seven children between the ages of one and fourteen. All of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer and Mariam works in a beauty salon. She has had this business for 10 years. Mariam will use her loan to buy more beauty products and with the profit she will increase the number of products that are used in her salon. She says her business is successful because she has many customers. In the future Mariam would like to sell other items such as women’s clothing.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es:
Dolores tiene un taller de reparación de aparatos eléctricos, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

El papa le enseño a reparar aparatos eléctricos, cuando creció tubo la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos por eso decidió tener un taller de reparación trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Una de las reparaciones que mas hace son de los ventiladores debido al calor que hay en Guayaquil. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para los aparatos eléctricos. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande para tener un puesto de venta de repuestos.
texts.en:
Dolores has a repair shop where she repairs electrical appliances.  She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (a place which is noted for the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal shopkeepers).

Her father taught her to repair electrical appliances.  When she grew up she needed to have her own income and for that reason she decided to open a repair shop.  She works from 9.00am to 8.00pm every day.  One of the most frequent repairs she makes is to electric fans as Guayaquil is a very hot place.

With her loan, Dolores would like to buy spare parts for electrical appliances.  In the future she would like to have larger premises so that she can have a place to sell spare parts.

loans.use: Spare parts

loans.name: Marina Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina Jesús; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de farmacia, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m y junto con su pareja sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar la farmacia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas al por mayor. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORIWASI” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

She is called Señora Marina Jesús; she is 27 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her pharmacy business. She runs the pharmacy from 8:00am to 11:00pm and together with her partner they provide for the future of their children. Señora Marina Jesús would like to expand the pharmacy. She is requesting a loan to buy medicine in bulk. 

She is grateful to those who are involved in making her dream possible and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy medicine in bulk.

loans.name: La Cruz De Yerbateros Group

texts.es:
Personas empeñosas por salir a delante, D. esta manera se denominan las integrantes del grupo  la Cruz D. Yerbateros , grupo conformado por 10 socias que entre el hogar y sus familias ven la forma D. llevar ingresos económicos a sus hogares por medio D. sus negocios.
  Tal así es el caso D. la señora Flor D. María C. D. 40 años D. edad casada y con 2 hijos que dependen D. ella. Hace más D. 7 años se dedica a la venta D. helados en el verano y en el invierno a la venta D. Emoliente el cual es una bebida D. la zona, esto lo hace con el mejor D. los esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante cada día por el bien D. ella y su familia y en el futuro le gustaría tener una heladería mucho mas equipada. Con el reciente préstamo ella implementará su mercadería, comprando productos para la temporada D. verano. Como la señora flor D. María C. el resto D. los integrantes tienen una historia en particular pero, todos coinciden en el esfuerzo y dedicación que brindan todos los días por el bien D. sus familias.
texts.en:
"People who are determined to make progress" - that is what the ten members of this Cruz D. Yerbateros group are known as. They see how to bring income into their homes through their business activities.

Such is the case of Señora Flor D. María C. who is 40 years of age, married and has two dependent children. For over seven years she has been selling ice creams in summer and "emoliente" (a traditional hot drink) in winter. Thus she makes her best effort every day so that she and her family can get on in life. In the future she would like to have a much better equipped ice-cream parlor.  She will use this loan to stock up, buying products for the summer season. 

Like Señora Flor D. María C., the other group members all have their own particular stories, but they all make great efforts and share the same dedication for the good of their families.

loans.use: To stock up, buying products for the summer season.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 29 años, es una joven madre de 2 hijos, vive en compañía de su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años,  Liz se dedica a la venta de ropa, mediante el pedido que le hacen sus clientes,  ya que desde niña fue su mayor anhelo. Hoy su gran carisma le ha dado ventaja para vender rápidamente sus productos, es por tal razón que siempre trata de complacer a sus clientes con variedad de prendas. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede ayudar a su esposo en cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que esta al pendiente de la moda, disfruta mucho de su trabajo, aunque eso implique que tenga que caminar mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner un bazar donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus prendas casuales. Es su sexto crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá en su negocio, para que pueda desarrollarse y crecer comercialmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en:
Liz is 29 years old; she is a young mother with two children and she and her husband live in their own house. 

For the last three years she has been selling clothing made to order for her clients. This had been her dream since childhood.  Today, her great charisma allows her to sell her products quickly, and she always tries to oblige her clients with a range of different clothes. Her work is very profitable, thus she is thankfully able to help her husband with the school fees for their children. What she likes most about her work is that it revolves around fashion. She enjoys it very much, even though it means that she has to do a lot of walking. In the future, she would like to have a market stall where she could sell her casual clothes more comfortably. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva Field Partner, MFP, and she is very happy to have it. She will use it to invest in her business so that it can develop and grow commercially. She will buy more clothing so that she can offer her clients greater choice.

loans.use: To stock up with clothing.

loans.name: Editha Modesta

texts.es:
Editha de 38 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura llamado “Rohi”. vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Inicio con el taller de confección hace dos años atrás con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Desde ese tiempo confecciona pantalones, vestidos, blusas. Trabaja con ayuda de una de sus sobrinas desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días.  

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere trabajar con empleados y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Editha is 38 years old and she has a dressmaking and sewing studio called "Rohi". She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an area where most residents are informal traders). 

She started her dressmaking studio two years ago with an old sewing machine and she was able to establish enough clients to cover her costs. Since that time she has been making trousers, dresses and blouses. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and is helped by one of her nieces. 
 
To progress with her dressmaking studio she wants to use this loan to buy material and a sewing machine. In the future she would like to have employees and to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy material and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Hector Manuel; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en una farmacia vendiendo medicinas, el es químico farmacéutico, el es propietario de una farmacia que atiende desde 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas al por mayor para la farmacia.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORIWASI” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

His name is Señor Hector Manuel; he is 32 years old, single and has two children. He is the owner of the pharmacy where he works as the pharmacist from 7:00am to 6:00pm, selling medicines. He would like to expand and improve his business. He is requesting this loan to buy medicine in bulk for the pharmacy.

He is grateful to those who are involved in making his dream a possibility through this loan, and he is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy medicines in bulk for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 37 años, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella, sus hermanos, su esposo Luis de 34 años y sus 3 jóvenes hijos. Recuerda con nostalgia como empezó con su negocio de venta de gas en su casa y  solo tenía 2 balones y nadie la ayudaba. Pero ahora no solo vende gas, sino también ofrece cervezas y gaseosas que tienen salida durante los fines de semana, además esta  muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Manifiesta que el negocio de venta le gusta mucho pues lo realiza con mucha tranquilidad en su casa, de esta manera no descuida las labores del hogar, y su hijo mayor la ayuda en el transporte de los balones de gas cuando tiene pedidos a domicilio. Además como es una mujer emprendedora que desea seguir con nuevos negocios, ya tiene planeado para el futuro comprar una carretilla y ubicarla fuera de su casa para vender diversas golosinas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, como siempre, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de cajas de cervezas y de gaseosas que necesita para surtir mejor su negocio, así espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Rosa is 37 years old and lives in her mothers home with her mother, her brothers and her husband Luis who is 34 years old and their 3 young children.  She remembers nostalgically how she began her business selling gas out of her home and only had 2 cylinders and no one helped her.  But now not only does she sell gas, but also offers beers, and sodas that they have out over the weekend.  She is very pleased as well to get a regular income that allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. It is evident that she loves the business very much and she can do it quietly at home without neglecting the housework. Her eldest son helps in transporting the gas cylinders when she has home orders. Also, as a woman entrepreneur who wants to continue with new stores, she has already planned for the future to purchase a truck and place it outside her house to sell various snacks, expecting to improve earnings. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to pay her fees punctually, as always, because she does not want to look bad to the people providing the money that will allow her to continue working and progressing. Rosa plans to invest the money from the loan in buying a large quantity of beer and soda cases that she needs to better stock her store and thus hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: To buy boxes of beers and sodas.

loans.name: Jehová Jireh Group

texts.es: Decisión, iniciativa y buenas propuestas de negocio es lo que identifica a este grupo de socias llamado Jehová Jireh el cual está conformado por 9 integrantes hace ya 4 años, todas ellas se conocen bien entre ellas ya que son vecinas. Cabe mencionar la iniciativa que presentan cada día para lograr éxitos en sus negocios. Una de las integrantes es Elsa Q. de 49 años de edad casada y con 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 aun siguen en el colegio. Ella se levanta todas las mañanas muy temprano para realizar la venta de tortas y pasteles el cual es su negocio diario, los ingresos económicos de estas ventas le han generado gratas satisfacciones como la compra de muebles para su hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de veta de ropa de temporada. Con el presente préstamo comprara complementos para los adornos de las tortas. No puedo concluir sin antes mencionar el desempeño y el entusiasmo de cada integrante de Jehová Hireh para llegar a un objetivo en común el cual es la estabilidad económica para sus familias y el progreso de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Decision, initiative and good business proposals are the words that identify this group of nine borrowers who have been together for four years now and called themselves Jehová Jireh. They all know each other well because they are neighbors. It is worth mentioning that they display initiative daily to be successful in their businesses.

Elsa Q. is one of the group members. She is 49 years old, married, and has three children, two of which are still in school. Every morning she gets up early to sell cakes and pastries, which is her daily business. Her income from these sales have provided her with fulfillment, as she has purchased furniture for her home and used it to pay for her children’s schooling. In the future, she would like to have a seasonal clothing store. With the current loan, she will purchase accessories for the cake decorations.

Before ending the description, it is necessary to mention the work and enthusiasm of each member of Jehová Jireh, as these are applied for the common goals of financial stability for their families and the progress of their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for cake decorations.

loans.name: Llankasunchis De Lares Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LLANKASUNCHIS DE LARES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Lares, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina ;   La socia  es conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijas ellas son gemelas de 4 años, La socia se dedica  a la atención de su restaurante, ella trabaja cocinando en su restaurante y tiene una prima que le ayuda con la atención al público en cuanto a llevar los platos y otras labores. La socia desea a futuro ampliar su pequeño negocio e implementar mas mesas, sillas y utensilios, La socia comprara algunos insumos como es el caso de aceite, papas al por mayor y otros para poder abastecerse. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos y víveres de primera necesidad para su negocio.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos venden maíz, papa, morralla, chuño entre otros productos agrícolas, también tienen tienda abarrotes, venta de animales menores y venta de pasto para cuyes.

Los socios Gregorio H. y Felipe S., aparecen juntos aparte de sus compañeros de banco porque estaban con permiso por motivos de trabajo, ellos trabajan algunas veces como porteadores en el camino inka; aquí los socios terminaban de firmar los documentos que les entregó el asesor de grupo y se añadió la foto al grupo para completar el ochenta por ciento de los socios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Paulina is a member of the communal bank “LLANKASUNCHIS DE LARES”, which is located in the Lares district, Calca province, in the Cusco region.

Señora Paulina lives with her partner and their two young daughters, who are 4 year old twins. She dedicates her to running her restaurant: she cooks in the restaurant and she has a cousin who helps her with serving the customers, clearing plates and other tasks. She would like in future to expand her little business and put in more tables, seats and utensils. She will buy some ingredients in bulk, such as cooking oil and potatoes among others, so that she has a good stock. She is seeking the loan to buy ingredients and food staples that she needs for her business. 

The other members of the communal bank combine running their households with their small businesses: they sell maize, potatoes, small fish, dried potatoes, among other agricultural produce. Among the members there is also a grocery store, animal sales, and the sale of feed for guinea-pigs.

The group members Gregorio H. and Felipe S. are shown in a separate photo because they were given permission to miss the group meeting for work reasons. They work as porters on the Inka Trail. In the photo, the group members had just finished signing the loan documentation given to them by their loan officer, and the photo of Gregorio and Felipe was added to the group photo in order to have at least 80% of the group members pictured [which is a requirement of Kiva].

Señora Paulina is grateful and values the loan offered through this channel, and promises to complete her repayments on time in the established place.

loans.use: The member is seeking the loan to buy ingredients and food staples for her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 30 años, es una madre de familia empeñada en sacar adelante a sus hijos, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos. En la actualidad, se dedica a las labores domesticas y en el cuidado de sus hijos. Pero antes que naciera su bebe, ella conducía  su moto carro,  realizando servicio de transporte a sus vecinos. Ahora se encarga de la administración de los ingresos diarios que le genera su moto, mientras que su esposo es el encargado de conducirlo, y siempre esta al pendiente de las revisiones técnicas que necesita el vehículo.  Se siente muy feliz realizando su trabajo y lo mas gratificante para ella son las ganancias que percibe en cada jornada, aunque lo mas tedioso es cuando se malogra la moto. Con el tiempo desea comprarse otra moto, de esa manera logrará tener mayores ganancias, ya que su único fin es brindar bienestar a su familia. Es su primer crédito con MFP y esta feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que lo invertirá todo su negocio de transporte. Con el crédito que solicita, pagará el seguro de su vehículo, asimismo renovará la pintura y cambiar el toldo.
texts.en:
Rocío, 30, is a mother determined to raise her children. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She is currently a housewife and looks after the children, but before the birth of her baby she used to provide motorcycle shuttle services to her neighbours. She now manages the daily income generated by the motorcycle services, whereas her husband is the one driving it. 

She is always vigilant as to the technical inspections required by the vehicle. She is very happy with her job and finds the daily earnings very rewarding. The most annoying thing is when the motorcycle breaks down. Over time she would like to buy another bike, so as to increase her profits, because at the end of the day her goal is to provide her family with the necessary comforts. 

This is her first credit with MFP and she is happy to be able to obtain it. She says she will invest it all in her transportation business. With the loan she will pay for the motor insurance, repaint the bike and change its tarpaulin.

loans.use: Pay the motor insurance, repaint her vehicle and buy a new tarpaulin.

loans.name: David Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORIWASI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. David Efrain; el tiene 51 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es propietario de una agencia de viajes, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar la agencia de viajes. El socio solicita el préstamo para la agencia de viajes para comprar una computadora.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “QORIWASI” community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and administrative district of the same name.

The member is Mr David Efrain who is 51 years old, single and has 2 children.  He is the owner of a travel agency where he works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  He would like to improve his travel agency and requests this loan for his travel agency in order to buy a computer.

The member thanks those who will help him fulfil his dream and pledges to make his loan repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his travel agency

loans.name: Ricchariy Llaqta Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “RICCHARIY LLAQTA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la comunidad D. Choquecancha, distrito D. Lares, provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santos ;   El socio  es casado  y tiene 3 hijos , El socio se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados, el socio también ahora es el nuevo regidor D. la comunidad, el entro junto a sus partido en las últimas selecciones, El socio continuará con sus tradicional trabajo D. compra y venta D. ganados. El socio requiere el crédito para invertir en su nueva compra D. ganados y aumentará a un dinero que tiene ahorrado. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ganados.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos  se dedican a diferentes labores como por ejemplo a la compra y venta D. ganados, a la agricultura, a la venta D. maíz, papa, morralla, chuño entre otros productos agrícolas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the  “RICCHARIY LLAQTA” village bank, located in the community of Choquecancha, District of Lares, Calca Province, in the Department of Cusco.  

His name is Santos.  He's married and has three children.  He earns his living buying and selling cattle.  He's also his community's new Adviser, having entered with his party into the last elections.  He will continue buying and selling cattle.  He needs a loan to invest in some new cows, for which he'll add in some of his own savings.  

The other members alternate their home activities with their retail businesses.  They work at different jobs, including, for example, buying and selling cattle, in agriculture, corn sales, potatoes, fish, potato flour, and other agricultural products.

Santos appreciates and values the loan he will receive here, and promises accordingly to make all his payments in full and on time.

loans.use: He is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Enemecio

texts.es:
don Enemecio es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicado a su negocio que es la reparacion de llantas, Enemecio es padre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela y en el colegio de la comunidad. 
el trabaja junto con su hermano.
Enemecio se levanta muy temprano para trabajar, su tiempo libre se lo dedica a la familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar unos repuestos para su equipo y unos materiales para la reparacion de llantas.
texts.en:
Enemecio is an enterprising man who is very dedicated to his tire repair business.  Enemecio is the father of 4 children who go to the local elementary school and high school.

He works together with his brother.

Enemecio gets up really early to work.  His spare time is spent with his family.  His loan will be used to buy some parts for his equipment and material for tire repairs.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for machine, tires, patches and adhesive

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Brima Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Brima” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Brima S.. Brima is 40. He was born in Bonthe, southern Sierra Leone but currently resides in Magburaka, together with his wife and four children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending school. Two of the children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Brima is a tailor and has been in this profession for five years. With his share of this loan, he will buy working materials like threads, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.use: To buy working materials like threads, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Mascot Group

texts.en:
Aminata M. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Kano, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, about 35 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children. Two of the children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

For four years now, Aminata has been selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, biscuits, cigarettes, etc. This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Yo buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, biscuits, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 36 años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de ella, sus hermanas, su esposo Fredy de 42 años que es chofer y sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. A partir de muy joven, esta emprendedora mujer se dedicó a trabajar en busca de un futuro mejor; y siempre ayudo a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Desde hace 1 año empezó a estudiar cosmetología, y hace 6 meses empezó a trabajar en lo que aprendió que es cortar el cabello, hacer peinados y también maquillar los rostros de las damas. Aunque solo atiende a conocidas y amigas tiene mucha ilusión de instalar en el futuro su propio salón de belleza; además dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite ofrecer el servicio en la tranquilidad de su casa, pues sus clientes la visitan ya que ella tiene casi todos los implementos necesarios para brindarles un buen servicio a un precio módico. Como si fuera poco paralelamente también lava ropa a sus vecinos que le pagan regularmente por sus servicios. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar con su negocio; también manifiesta  que le gusta mucho el trabajo de los miembros de su grupo porque todos son trabajadores y emprendedores al igual que ella. Consuelo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una secadora y otros implementos como cosméticos que le hacen falta para seguir ofreciéndoles el cómodo servicio de corte de cabello y maquillaje a sus clientes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Consuelo, 36-years-old, lives in her mother's house with her mother, her sisters, and her husband, Fredy (42-years-old), who's a chauffeur, and their two small children. Everyday they work together to get ahead. From a young age this hardworking woman has worked hard in search of a better future, and she's always helped her husband with the constant home expenses. One year ago she began studying cosmetology; six months ago she began working as a barber/stylist and makeup artist. Even though she currently only services friends and acquaintances, she hopes to open her own beauty salon one day. She says that she likes her work a lot because it allows her to offer her services in the comfort of her own home. Her customers visit her because she has nearly all of the necessary tools to offer them a good service at a reasonable price. She also does laundry for her neighbors, who pay her regularly for her services. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually because she doesn't want to upset the people who have made the loan possible that will permit her to continue her business. She would also like to say that she likes the work of her group members because they're all very hard working and enterprising, just like her. Consuelo plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a hair dryer and other cosmetic implements that she needs to continue offering her comfortable beauty service to her clients; she hopes to keep progressing in that direction.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryer and cosmetics to offer a good service

loans.name: New Line Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “New Line” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org ,to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Mamusu S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children who are attending primary school. Mamusu has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells cigarettes, biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, torchlights, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, torchlights, etc.

loans.name: Ndiongolor Eglise Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois de NDIONGOLOR EGLISE a été créé le 14 octobre 2010. Il est composé de 50 femmes vivant dans un même village et pratiquant d'une manière générale la même activité .

Madame Khady L. mise en médaillon ; est responsable du groupe ,elle a 49 ans .elle est veuve et a 6 enfants et sa mère en charge. 
Elle fait du commerce de mil et de porcs.et avec son prêt de 50000 francs elle compte augmenter ses fond de commerce.
Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidien de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of the church of Ndiongolor was created on October 14, 2010. It is composed of 50 women from the same village who are all engaged in similar type of work.

Mrs. Khady L., whose photo appears in the medallion, is the group’s leader. She is 49 years old and a widow, taking care of her six children as well as of her own mother. She sells millet and pigs. She plans to use her loan of 50,000 West African Franc to bolster her business capital. The income generated by her business will allow her to provide for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing millet, peanuts and pork

loans.name: Free Gospel Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Free Gospel” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business owners who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to receive a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Samuel B.. Samuel was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, thirty-five years ago. He is married and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary school. Samuel sells cigarettes, toothpaste, and toothbrushes, among other things, and has been running this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, Samuel will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, toothpaste and toothbrushes

loans.name: No Problem Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “No Problem” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Susan D. K.. Susan is age 35 and was born in Magburaka town. She is married with three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school.  

Susan sells palm oil, rice and groundnuts. She has been doing this business for many years. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil and rice in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
En  Caapucu-Yere distante se formó mediante el deseo de las señoras  de integrar un comité está integrada por 17 señoras muy trabajadoras y activas, este Comité está en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente.
 Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas.
Buscan un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida. Una de las integrantes es la señora Antonia quien se dedica a la venta Joyas.
Esta actividad lo realiza hace un buen  tiempo para aumentar los ingresos de su familia y de manera ayudarle a su marido.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas de plata ya que de acerca la temporada de mucha compra por parte de la gente.
texts.en: In far Caapucu-Yere a group formed out of the desire of some women to integrate a committee; it's made up of 17 very hardworking and active women. This committee is on its fourth loan and has an excellent reputation. The group is very united and works together. They never have trouble making their payments or getting along with each other. They're looking for a little more support to fund their family expenses and improve their quality of life. One of the members is Antonia, who sells jewelry. She's done this work for quite a while to supplement her family's income, and as a way to help her husband. She's requesting this loan for the purchase of silver jewelry because they shopping season is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Respect Father Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org located in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Respect Father” group. These individuals are small-scale entrepreneurs who have all come to SMT/Kiva to request individual loans of SLL 500,000 in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adamsay C. is the leader of this group. Adamsay is thirty years old and is married with five children. Three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Adamsay sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), rice, palm oil, groundnuts, and other items. She has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now. Adamsay is going to use her share of the loan to buy the materials used to make gara lapper in order to produce a large quantity of gara cloths. She will also use part of the loan to buy bags of rice for her rice selling business.

loans.use: To buy materials to make gara lapper (locally dyed cloth) and to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Good Members Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Good Members” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 400,000 for each to enable them to improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Adama J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adama was born in Magburaka town. She is 41 years old. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a dealer in diamonds and her children are attending schools. Two of the children are in primary school, three are in secondary school and one is in college. 

Adama sells fish, cassava roots and firewood. She has 26 years of experience in this business. With her share of this loan, she will buy cartons of fish, bundles of firewood and bags of cassava roots to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fish, bundles of firewood and bags of cassava roots to add to her business

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
María de 47 años, elabora y vende zapatillas con sus hijos de 17, 16, 15, 12 y 10 años ellos viven en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Hace un año le dieron una liquidación de trabajo a uno de sus hijos con ese dinero compro algunos materiales para hacer zapatillas y venderlas al por mayor, Ella y sus hijos cuando salen del colegio cosen y pegan zapatillas para venderlas a las tiendas desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Cada zapatilla de mujer la venden a $ 25.00, y las de hombre a $ 30.00 c/u.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tiras y plantas de zapatillas para su elaboración. En el futuro quiere tener una microempresa de entrega de zapatillas.
texts.en:
María, forty-seven, makes and sells sandals with her children, who are seventeen, sixteen, fifteen, twelve, and ten-years-old.  They live in Guasmo de Guayaquil (characterized primarily by its population of informal merchants).  

A year ago one of her children got a severance package from work, and used the money to buy some supplies for making sandals to sell wholesale.  When the children get out of school, they and María sew and glue the sandals so they can be sold at the stores between 8AM and 5PM.  The women's sandals sell for $25.00 and the men's for $30.00.

María wants to use her loan to buy straps and soles.  In the future she would like to have a small sandal shipping business.

loans.use:
Tiras, plantas de zandalias 
Sandle straps and soles.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tawopaneh II” group from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesspeople seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu F., pictured on the left. Kadiatu is age 50 and was born in the village of Matobie. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. One of the children is in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

Kadiatu sells dried fish and has been doing this business for 25 years now. With this loan, Kadiatu is going to expand her fish business by buying baskets of dried fish to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current ones

loans.name: We Go Try Group

texts.en:
Hawanatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Port Loko town, in northern Sierra Leone, Hawanatu is divorced with two children.  For 25 years now, she has been selling rice, onions, etc. in the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. Hawanatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy bags of rice and onions to add to her business. 

This is the first loan that Hawanatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

(Included in the left of the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah handing over the loan to the members of "We Go Try Group")

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and onions to add to her business

loans.name: Look To We Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Look To We” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of SLL 3,200,000 in order to boost their respective businesses. 

Isatu A. K. is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni city. She is married to a businessman and they have five children who are attending primary school. Isatu sells fertilizer and pepper seeds. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of fertilizers, pepper, and “krain krain” seeds.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of fertilizers, pepper, and “krain krain” seeds

loans.name: Sopp Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité sopp sa jeker est créé le 27 septembre 2009 il est composer de 11 membres.elles se sont unis par voisinage .leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame ALIMA M. debout a l'extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe elle a 32 ans ,marié et mère de 5 enfants.
Elle fait du petit commerce de jus de fruit.

Son nouveau crédit lui servira  d'acheter de la matière premiers pour faire les jus, afin de pouvoir rapidement 
accroitre ses bénéfice.
Avec les profits générés elle fait de l'épargne et acheté ses besoin en habillement et bijoux
texts.en:
The "Sopp sa jeker" solidarity group  was created on September 27, 2009. It is composed of 11 members. These women are neighbors who decided to form a group together. Their main business activity is  retail. Mrs. Alima M., standing at the far right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of five.

She sells fruit juices. Her new loan will allow her to purchase ingredients for making juices, in order to be able to increase her revenues quickly. She uses the revenues to grow her savings and to purchase necessary clothing and jewelry.

loans.use: Developing and promoting her business

loans.name: Colon

texts.es:
