He raises the livestock and when they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to merchants who visit the region where he lives. This is his primary source of income and so he tries to do his very best.

Laureano wants to acquire more livestock to expand his business and see an increase in his ales.  He has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles to reach his goal. 

He is a very calm and entrepreneurial person. His goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es:
Inocente es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele instalar algunos granos y menestras. Esta actividad es la fuente mas importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trata de manejarla del mejor modo posible. 

En esta oportunidad Inocente ha instalado el cultivo de pallar, el desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su terreno. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Inocente es una persona bastante activa y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inocente is a family man. He is 37 years old and he lives together with his wife and their children in the community of Muy Finca in the district of Mochumi. It is an agricultural region within the province of Lambayeque, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He is an agriculturist. He has his own farm land where he sows grains and produce. This is a very important business because it is a source of income for his family, which is why he has always endeavored to do his very best. 

He is sowing a plantation of fava beans and he wants to purchase fertilizer to improve is fields. He has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 600 neuvos soles to reach his goal. 

Inocente is an active person and is very devoted to his family. His goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jaime Wather

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padrs en el sector Atusparias del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza. 

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la comercialización ambulante de frutas, el recorre las diferentes calles de Chiclayo y su distrito ofreciendo su mercadería y ya cuenta con clientela fija, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de sus gastos personales y apoyando a la economía de su familia.

Jaime desea invertir en la compra de más frutas de estación para surtir su negocio y ampliar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es adquirir una moto carguera que le permita movilizarse con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents in the community of Atusparias in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz. It is one of the most populous districts in the region but it is also one of the poorest regions.

For the past ten years he has sold fresh fruit along the streets of Chiclayo and in his neighborhood. He sells his products to a steady client base and the income he earns he uses to cover his personal expenses and he contributes to the family economy.

Jaime wishes to invest in the purchase of more fruit to add variety to his business and see an improvement in his sales and profits. He has requests a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to reach his goal. 

His is a very hard working and responsible person. His goal is to purchase a motorcycle to be able to travel and transport with greater ease.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Eva Susana

texts.es:
Eva tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Salas, un distrito agrícola conocido por su geografía accidentada y por ser uno de los principales lugares a nivel nacional donde se practica el curanderismo o medicina folclórica. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega situada en su domicilio. Ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personas y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Su negocio resulta de bastante utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona se encuentra bastante alejada de las zonas comerciales. Por ello Eva siempre se esfuerza por mantenerlo del mejor modo posibe. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Eva es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y llegar a convertir su tienda en la más surtida de la zona.
texts.en:
Eva is 30 years old, she is single and she lives with her parents in the community of Salas, an agricultural region known for its mountainous geography and for being one of the national centers for holistic and traditional medicines. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries from a store located in her home. She provides various products of daily use in a convenient location. The profits she earns are used to cover her personal expenses and to contribute to the family's daily finances. 

Her business is very helpful to her neighbors because the region where they live is very far from shopping centers. Eva always endeavors to run her business in the best way possible. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products to see an increase in her sales and in her profits. She has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles. 

Eva is someone who very much wants to succeed. Her goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to one day to have her store be the one with the most variety in the region.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María Ricardina es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hija de dos años (junto con ella en la fotografía). Reside en el sector San Pedro Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, por un lado se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ovejas, las cuales engorda y luego ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, los cuales vende a las empresas procesadoras que están instaladas en la zona. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que desea trabajar y salir adelante para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
María Ricardina is a 22 year old mother who lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter (who is with her in the photo above). She lives in the San Pedro Hualtaco neighborhood, in the agricultural District of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura Province, and is in a region with the same name. This area is less than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

Maria works in agriculture. Firstly, she raises and sells small cattle, like sheep, which she fattens and then sells to merchants who tend to visit the region. Additionally, she has a small plot of farm land where she plants lemons and mangos, which she sells to processing plants that operate in the region. The income she receives from these activities is used to help her husband with the financial support of their household. 

Maria would like to purchase fertilizers to maintain her crop, and because of this she has solicited for the first time a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a woman who wants to work and get ahead in life to improve her family’s quality of life. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to maintain her crop.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Santa Rosa del distrito Las Lomas de la provincia de Piura. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele instalar maíz. Esta actividad es la fuente mas importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trata de manejarla del mejor modo posible. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino.

Porfirio desea adquirir fertilizantes y semillas para instalar una vez más el cultivo de maíz en su terreno. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es un padre bastante emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 53, is married and lives with his wife and children in Santa Rosa, Las Lomas district, Piura province.  The area is located in Piura region over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

He is a farmer.  He has a field where he usually plants corn.  This activity is his most important source of family income so he always strives to care for it in the best possible way.  He also raises sheep to sell.

Porfirio wants to get fertilizes and seed to plant corn on his property.  He is, therefore, asking for his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal.

He is quite an enterprising father with a strong drive to get ahead.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and corn seed.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y  reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de carne de pollo, ella adquiere este producto al por mayor y lo vende en su domicilio. Asimismo lo distribuye en las principales bodegas de la zona. El negocio tiene mucha acogida debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella se encarga de apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Genara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia desarrollarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Genara, 43, is married and lives with her husband and a son in the agricultural Tambogrande district which is part of Piura province, Piura region, located over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

She is a chicken retailer.  She buys the chicken at wholesale and sells it from home.  She also sells to the main stores in her area.  The business is quite well received because of the time she’s been in operation and the good customer service she provides.  Income from it allows her to help her husband support the household.

Genara wants to enlarge the business buying more merchandise in order to meet customer demand.  She is, therefore, asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal.

She is quite an active and enterprising woman.  Her greatest wish is to see her family develop and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Anenia

texts.en:
Anenia M. is from the Barangay of Manguehan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She is 54 years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store, which she has done for 14 years. Anenia earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 a month.

In January 2005, Anenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan amount of PHP 3,000.00 and is now requesting her seventh loan in the amount of PHP 14,900.00 to be used as additional capital for her store.
Anenia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for her children’s education, insurance, and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her retail (sari-sari) store

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora G. is from the Barangay of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 50 years of age, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in the snack vending business, which she has done for six years. Aurora earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 a month.

In 2005, Aurora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan amount of PHP 14,900.00 and is now requesting her fourth loan in the amount of PHP 10,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store.  Aurora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for the insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for food vending

location.town: Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pablo David

texts.es: Pablo tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, es es el sustento de su familia, se inició en este negocio hace ya 6 años, ahora ya cuenta con una mototaxi propia la cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo producto de sus ahorros de trabajo, el sueña con adquirir más mototaxis y asi poder mejora la calidad de vida de su familia, solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y buena capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Pablo is 32 years old, single, and lives in his parent's home.  He supports the family.  He started out in this business 6 years ago, and now he has his own mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) which he acquired with a lot of effort with money he saved from working.  He dreams of buying more mototaxis, so that he could improve the quality of life of his family.  He requests a loan to do maintenance work on his mototaxi.  He is being provided with this loan because he has good personal references and the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his mototaxi

loans.name: Jose Lino

texts.en:
Jose,22, lives with his parents in their home in the town of San Isidro, located in a rural region 40 minutes to the north of Chiclayo in a district called Morrope. The community in the area consists primarily of agricultural workers, artisans and individuals who raise animals.

For the last year Jose has been purchasing and selling corn, beans, lentils, and peas. He purchases his products from wholesalers in the major market of Chiclayo, the Moshoqueque market. He then returns to his home town in order to sell his goods at retail prices to the local residents. Jose also works as a farm hand when he is not managing his business.

This will be Jose’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He has requested the funds in order to purchase additional merchandise, hoping the loan will give him access to additional discounts so that he can increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce for his business

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.en:
Maria is thirty-one years old. She lives in her own home with her husband in the town of San Isidro. San Isidro is located in a rural region forty minutes to the north of Chiclayo in a district called Morrope. The community in the area primarily consists of agricultural workers, artisans and individuals who raise animals.

Maria produces artisan goods in her home and also raises animals in her backyard. She uses these two activities to assist in stabilizing her income.  Her animals include chickens, ducks and sheep.

This will be Maria’s first loan with our institution, however she has worked with financial institutions in the past. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional animals and feed. She hopes to be able to take advantage of bulk prices and the high demand that will exist during the holiday season.

She is well respected in her community and very hard working. She dreams of expanding her business in order to be able to better support her family and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: María Olinda

texts.en:
Maria is twenty-three years old.  She lives five minutes outside of the town of Morrope, a small rural village to the north of the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  The population is primarily of low income and works in agriculture.

Maria participates in two income generating activities.  She raises animals in the yard behind her home and she also produces artisan goods.  Her animals include chickens, ducks and sheep.  She raises them to the appropriate size and then transports them to the wholesale market of Chiclayo.  The market is approximately forty minutes from her home, but is where she finds the most demand and best prices.

The current credit has been requested in order to purchase additional animals and feed.  Maria hopes to be able to get a bulk discount on the food and raise the animals rapidly in order to take advantage of the greater demand during the holiday season.

The community has given good references for Maria and our analysts note her hard work and stead fastness.  Edpyme Alternativa approves her request for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand her business raising and selling them.

loans.name: Liza Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza Fe A. is from the Barangay of Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and blessed with two children, both of whom are students. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (retail) store. Liza Fe has been running this business for the past eight years, and she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

Liza Fe joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in April 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid a previous 5,000 PHP loan. Liza Fe is now requesting her third loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her store.

Liza Fe plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for the future, make loan repayments and pay for her children’s education, along with paying for insurance and possible business expansion.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for retail (sari-sari) store

loans.name: Unico Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Único está integrado por tres socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la comunidad. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. Nolvia del Carmen Munguía, ella tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Solares Nuevos en el municipio de La Unión, Olancho.  Nolvia es una mujer luchadora que desde muy temprana edad inició a trabajar para ganarse la vida, en la actualidad tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella y su esposo  y como su negocio es muy visitado por sus vecinos tienen un horario de atención de 6:00 am a 9:00 pm. La sra. Nolvia por los momentos no enfrenta ningún problema de salud pero en algunas temporadas las ventas bajan y sus ganancias también.  Su meta es ampliar el negocio y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias para que su estilo de vida mejore. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, galletas, churros, dulces, condimentos, pastas, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan. Ella tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y está  muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido y es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos.  Las otras integrantes del grupo son: Vilia Oneida L. Z., ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su pulpería y Carmen María T. para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos que vende de forma ambulante en la comunidad.
texts.en:
The "Solidario Único" group is made up of 3 members, who each has her own economic activity in the local community. The group's co-ordinator is Señora Nolvia del Carmen Munguía. She is 49 years old, married with 6 children, and lives with her family in the Solares Nuevos neighbourhood, in the town of La Unión, Olancho. 

Nolvia is a determined woman who began working for a living at a very young age. She now has a small grocery store in her home, which she and her husband run. The store is well-used by their neighbours, with opening hours from 6am to 9pm. For the moment, Señora Nolvia has no health problems, but there are seasons when sales drop and so do her earnings. Her goal is to grow the business and in this way increase her earnings to improve her quality of life. She is seeking the loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, butter, meat, chicken, canned foods, bread, cookies, churros, sweets, sauces, pasta, etc. With the help of the loan, she will have more and better stock in her store, and her customers will be able to buy everything they need. She has worked with [field partner] FAMA before and is very grateful for the support she has received. She is very reliable in making her repayments. 

The other members of the group are: Vilia Oneida L. Z., who is seeking the loan to invest in her grocery store, and Carmen María T., who will invest in buying cosmetics that she will sell door-to-door in her community.

loans.use: To buy groceries generally

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester S. is from the village of Cobungan, Sinian, Baliangao. She is 50 years old and married with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a agriculture business growing rice to sell. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.  

Ester joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ester from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Alan Javier

texts.es: Alan Javier Z. L. tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, padre de dos hijos y reside en el Barrio Flores en el municipio de La Unión, Olancho. Alan tiene un taller de mecánica que opera hace algunos años en una parte del solar de su casa de habitación y mientras él trabaja su esposa se dedica a cuidar a los niños y a los quehaceres del hogar. Alan aprendió su oficio como empleado de un taller y cuando él sintió que tenía el conocimiento necesario para trabajar solo decidió instalar su propio negocio. Su ventaja es que es una persona muy amigable así que su taller es muy visitado por vecinos de la comunidad. Una de sus dificultades es que no tiene otra entrada de dinero y en ciertas temporadas los trabajos a realizar son muy pocos. Él solicita el financiamiento para comprar más herramientas de trabajo y así prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes una variada gama de repuestos para vehículos y con esto tendrá más ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Alan Javier Z. L., 24, is married and the father of two children.  He lives in La Unión’s Flores neighborhood, Olancho.  He has had a machine shop in his house for several years and while he works his wife cares for the children and does the household chores.

Alan learned his skill as an employee in a workshop and when he felt he’d acquired sufficient skills to work independently he decided to set up his own workshop.  His advantage is that he’s a very friendly person so his workshop is very well attended by neighbors.  One of the difficulties he faces, however, is that he doesn’t have any other source of income and sometimes he only has a few jobs to do.

He is asking for funding to buy more work tools so that he can provide better customer service.  His dream is to expand his business offering his customers a variety of vehicle replacement parts so that his income will be greater thus providing his family with better quality of life.

He has been in FAMA for several cycles and has been very responsible with his payments.

loans.use: To buy hand tools.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 47 years old and married with five adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates an agriculture business growing rice to sell. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Virginia joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2004 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to use as additional capital for rice production. This loan will be the thirteenth loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 55 years old, married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Flaviana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and selling assorted crops. She has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flaviana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to redeem her pawned land. This will be Flaviana’s 4th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned land

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn A. is from the village of Mitimos, Rizal. She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Junelyn owns & operates a grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Junelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase new stock for her store. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be Junelyn’s 8th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the store

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joann P., 24, is from the village of Dalumpinas. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Joann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising and selling hogs. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Joann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for personal purposes. She is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Joann’s 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: María Idalia

texts.es: María Idalia M. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 9 y 4 años D. edad. María trabaja en su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado sobre la calle principal, frente al mercado D. San Martín, la cual es una zona  muy concurrida por lo que es muy beneficioso para su negocio. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo comprando y vendiendo ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo comercializa ropa interior y sabanas para niños. Este negocio es la única fuente D. ingresos con la cual cuenta esta familia, por lo que María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. invertir en la compra D. más ropa y D. esta manera aumentar sus ventas lo cual es lo principal para María y su esposo ya que D. esta forma podrán contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: María Idalia M. D. M., thirty-seven, lives in San Martín, in the Department of San Salvador, with her husband, and two children, who are nine and four-years-old.  She works in her own business on the main street in front of the San Martín market, a high-traffic area, which is great for business.  She works with her husband buying and selling men's and women's clothing and children's underclothing and sheets.  The business is the family's only source of income, so María is seeking a loan through Apoyo Integral to invest in more clothing.  That way she can increase sales, which is most important to her and her husband because it will help them have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for making paper bags to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga. She is 58 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing crops to sell. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Karla Griselda

texts.es: Karla Griselda M. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado en una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad. Karla es una mujer muy emprendedora, quien cuenta con tres negocio, todo con el deseo de poder aportar lo más posible a su hogar. Ella posee una pupusería en la cual cada noche se encarga de elaborar y vender pupusas, así mismo comercializa perfumes para hombres y mujeres y así también vende ropa para ambos sexos. Karla es una madre de familia muy responsable quien lucha por una vida mejor para sus hijos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas como: queso, maíz, frijoles y otros más; así mismo desea invertir en la compra de perfumes y ropa de manera que sus ganancias se incrementen.
texts.en:
Karla Griselda M. C. is 34 years old and lives in the Department of Santa Ana with her husband who is an employee in a private company and her two children who are 13 and 8 years old.

Karla is a very enterprising woman who owns three businesses because she wishes to be able to contribute as much as possible to her household. She has a stall from which she sells “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, pork, chicken, etc.) and works there every evening making and selling pupusas.  She also sells men's and women's perfume and clothing for both men and women.

Karla is a very responsible mother who is fighting to provide a better life for her children. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy all the raw materials she needs for making pupusas such as: cheese, corn, beans and other ingredients. She also hopes to invest in the purchase of perfume and clothes to increase her profits.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. is from the village of Oscariz Ramon. She is 57 years old. Francisca is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo D. is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Divisoria, Santiago City in the province of Isabela on the Luzon islands. Reynaldo runs a general store from which he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Reynaldo has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Reynaldo successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan, his third from ASKI, of 9000 PHP that will be used for the same purpose. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita M. is 46 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of La Torre in the municipality of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya province in the Luzon islands. Perlita raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Perlita is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 19,000 PHP that will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario B. is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Nabbotuan within the municipality of Solana, Cagayan province on the Luzon islands. Rosario runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Rosario has been in business for over thirty years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Rosario is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Marylene

texts.en:
Marylene C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 35 years old. Marylene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marylene owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marylene has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marylene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marylene is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is divorced and lives with her four children. She has received a junior high education. Adjoa smokes fish to sell at Elmina. She uses the income she makes from her sales to ensure that her family is well taken care of. She will use the loan to buy some more fish to process and sell.

With the new profits from her extended business, Adjoa plans to invest in her business and to educate her children.

On the tray in the picture, are some fish for display.

loans.use: To buy some more fish to process

loans.name: Esther Efua Atta

texts.en:
Esther Efua Atta A. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school.  Her husband is a prison officer. Esther smokes fish (herring) at Elmina for sale. She has been in this trade for some time now. She is asking for a loan to purchase larger quantities of fish to smoke (process) for resale. 

Esther uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esther plans to reinvest her additional income.

Esther has, in her traditionally built oven, fish being smoked, and has just removed a few to display.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish to smoke (process) for resale.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa M. is a fish monger at Elmina.  Adwoa has received a senior high education.  She is divorced and takes care of her four children. Her loan will be used to buy an extra quantity of fish, which is going to help her expand her business. She ensures that her children’s basic needs are met. She hopes to educate her children with the additional income that will be generated from the loan. 

In this photograph, Adwoa is standing behind her traditionally built oven with some fish on display.

loans.use: To buy an extra quantity of fish

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married with one child who is not currently in school. Janet runs a pharmacy, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicine.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business into wholesale. 

Janet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her pharmacy
